query.description: Show every access of this field in this time range.

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- Show every access of this field in this time range --

--

-- Shows each field access and what thread it happened in, ordered by the time -- it occurred. Accesses marked as being 'Under Construction' happened while -- the object was being initialized. Clicking on an access will open the -- relevant line in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsTimeThe time this field access occurred
AccessThe type of field access, either a Read or a Write
--

-- META-END SELECT '?Package?' "Package__('@PK')", '?Class?' "Class", '?Class (Image)?' "Class__(icon)",'?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", THO.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')|", A.TS "Time", CASE WHEN A.RW = 'R' THEN 'Read' ELSE 'Write' END "Access", CASE WHEN A.UNDERCONSTRUCTION = 'N' THEN ' ' ELSE 'Yes' END "Under Construction__(c)", CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__(hide)", CO.CLASSNAME "Class__(hide)", S.ATLINE "Line__(hide)", A.ID "AID__(hide)", A.TRACE "ATRACE__(hide)" FROM ACCESS A, OBJECT THO, TRACE T, SITE S, OBJECT CO WHERE T.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = T.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS AND THO.Id = A.InThread AND A.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND A.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND A.TS BETWEEN '?Start?' AND '?End?' AND A.INTHREAD = ?ThreadId? ORDER BY A.TS ASC

query.description: Show every access of this static field in this time range.

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- Show every access of this field in this time range --

--

-- Shows each field access and what thread it happened in, ordered by the time -- it occurred. Clicking on an access will open the -- relevant line in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsTimeThe time this field access occurred
AccessThe type of field access, either a Read or a Write
--

-- META-END SELECT '?Package?' "Package__('@PK')", '?Class?' "Class", '?Class (Image)?' "Class__(icon)",'?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", THO.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')|", A.TS "Time", CASE WHEN A.RW = 'R' THEN 'Read' ELSE 'Write' END "Access", CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__(hide)", CO.CLASSNAME "Class__(hide)", S.ATLINE "Line__(hide)", A.ID "AID__(hide)", A.TRACE "ATRACE__(hide)" FROM ACCESS A, OBJECT THO, TRACE T, SITE S, OBJECT CO WHERE T.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = T.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS AND THO.Id = A.InThread AND A.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND A.RECEIVER IS NULL AND A.TS BETWEEN '?Start?' AND '?End?' AND A.INTHREAD = ?ThreadId? ORDER BY A.TS ASC

query.description: Show Tables

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- Show Tables --

--

-- Lists all of the database tables and their column descriptors. --

-- META-END select st.TABLENAME "Table", sco.columnname "Column__|", sco.columndatatype "Column Data Type", sco.autoincrementvalue "Autoincrement Value", sco.autoincrementstart "Autoincurement Start", sco.autoincrementinc "Autoincrement Increment" from sys.sysschemas sc,sys.systables st,sys.syscolumns sco where sc.schemaname = 'FLASHLIGHT' and st.schemaid = sc.schemaid and sco.referenceid = st.tableid order by st.tablename,sco.columnnumber

query.description: Stack Trace

ad-hoc.query: SELECT s.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", s.CLASSNAME "Class", s.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", s.INFILE "File", s.LOCATION "Location", s.ATLINE "Line__(r)" FROM TABLE (STACKTRACE(?TRACE?)) s

query.description: What accesses are made in this object during this block of time?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What accesses are made in the object during this block of time? --

 --

--Displays all accesses that occurred during the period of time in which the --analysis suspected false sharing might be going on. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsRead CountThe number of times this field was read in this thread
Write CountThe number of times this field was written in this thread
Reads During ConstructionThe number of times this field was read in this thread while the owning object was under construction
Writes During ConstructionThe number of times this field was written in this thread while the owning object was under construction
StartThe time of the first field access in this block.
StopThe time of the last field access in this block.
--

--META-END SELECT '?Package?' "Package__('@PK')", '?Class?' "Class", '?Class (Image)?' "Class__(icon)", S.FIELDNAME "Field__|", S.CODE "Field__(icon)", S.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')", S.READS "Read Count__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.WRITES "Write Count__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.START "Start", S.STOP "Stop", S.THREADID "ThreadId__(hide)", S.FIELDID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM TABLE (BLOCKSUMMARY(?Receiver?, '?Start?', '?Stop?')) S

query.description: What accesses do these two fields make during this block of time?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What accesses do these two fields make during this block of time? --

 --

--Displays all accesses that occurred between these two fields during the period --of time in which the analysis suspects false sharing might be going on. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsRead CountThe number of times this field was read in this thread
Write CountThe number of times this field was written in this thread
Reads During ConstructionThe number of times this field was read in this thread while the owning object was under construction
Writes During ConstructionThe number of times this field was written in this thread while the owning object was under construction
StartThe time of the first field access in this block.
StopThe time of the last field access in this block.
--

--META-END SELECT '?Package?' "Package__('@PK')", '?Class?' "Class", '?Class (Image)?' "Class__(icon)", S.FIELDNAME "Field__|", S.CODE "Field__(icon)", S.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')", S.READS "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.WRITES "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.START "Start", S.STOP "Stop", S.THREADID "ThreadId__(hide)", S.FIELDID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM TABLE (FIELDSBLOCKSUMMARY(?Receiver?, '?Start?', '?Stop?', ?FieldId?, ?RFieldId?)) S

query.description: What are the edges for this lock cycle?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT OBJID(LOCKHELD) "Held", OBJID(LOCKACQUIRED) "Acquired", OBJID(THREAD) "Thread", COUNT "Count__(add-commas)(r)", FIRSTTIME "First Acquired", LASTTIME "Last Acquired", LOCKHELD "LockHeld", LOCKACQUIRED "LockAcquired" FROM LOCKCYCLETHREAD WHERE COMPONENT = ?Cycle?

query.description: What fields (non-static) are shared after object construction?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No non-static fields are shared between two or more threads after object construction. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (non-static) are shared after object construction? --

--

-- Lists all the non-static fields accessed by more than one thread. -- This does not include accesses that happened during object creation. -- Provides some summary information about the number of reads and -- writes of each field, as well as how many shared objects are created -- that contain this field. Clicking on a field opens its -- declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field
InstancesThe number of shared objects that contain this -- field
Threads InvolvedThe number of threads involved in accessing all -- shared instances of this field
--

--

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows several non-static fields in the --ChatTestClient class. We can see from the --Instances column that only one ChatTestClient --object had these fields accessed by multiple threads. In this one --object, the f_connectedToGameServer field was accessed by --three different threads . It was read twice and written three times, --with one of those writes occurring in the ChatTestClient --constructor. --

--END-INFO select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__|", F.Code "Field__(icon)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) + SUM(FI.ReadCount) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) + SUM(FI.WriteCount) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) "Reads During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) "Writes During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", MAX(FIRC.RC) "Instances__(add-commas)(r)", COUNT(DISTINCT THO.ThreadName) "Threads Involved__(add-commas)(r)", F.Id "FieldId__(hide)" from OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FI, OBJECT THO, (SELECT FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT RECEIVER) "RC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD GROUP BY FIELD) AS FIRC, FIELDINSTANCESHARED SHARED where F.DeclaringType = O.Id and FI.FIELD = F.ID and FI.FIELD = SHARED.FIELD and FI.RECEIVER = SHARED.RECEIVER and THO.ID = FI.Thread and FIRC.FIELD = F.ID group by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,O.ClassCode,F.FieldName,F.Code,F.Id order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName

query.description: What fields (non-static) are shared during object construction?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No fields are accessed by multiple threads during construction -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(empty-is-good-news) -- No fields are accessed by multiple threads during construction -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(result-is-bad-news) -- Some fields are accessed by multiple threads during construction -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (non-static) are shared during object construction? --

--

-- Fields that are accessed by more than one thread before their enclosing object -- has finished construction run the risk of being seen in an -- uninitialized state. This query displays any fields that were -- observed to be accessed by two or more threads before construction -- ended. Clicking on a field will open its declaration in the code -- view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field
Reads During ConstructionThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
Writes During ConstructionThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
InstancesThe number of shared objects that contain this -- field
Threads InvolvedThe number of threads involved in accessing all -- shared instances of this field
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows two fields that were accessed by multiple --threads during object construction. We can see from the --Instances column that six Zookeeper object had --the state field accessed by multiple threads. Over all six objects, there --were 208 reads and 12 writes of state, with three reads and --four writes occurring in the constructor. To see the instances of --Zookeeper that were actually seen by multiple threads while --being initialized, you would run the query "What are the --improperly published instances of this non-static field?" --

--

--It is important to note that the query does not prove either of these --fields were improperly published. It may be that there is a --happens-before event of some sort between the reads and writes of each --field. This would be the case if a thread was initialized in a --constructor and this was passed into the new thread. If --the state of this is not modified afterwards, then there is --no danger that the program will behave unexpectedly. --

-- META-END select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__|", F.Code "Field__(icon)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) + SUM(FI.ReadCount) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) + SUM(FI.WriteCount) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) "Reads During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) "Writes During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", COUNT(FI.Receiver) "Instances__(add-commas)(r)", COUNT(DISTINCT THO.ThreadName) "Threads Involved__(add-commas)(r)", F.Id "FieldId__(hide)" from BADPUBLISH B, OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FI, OBJECT THO where F.ID = B.FIELD and F.DeclaringType = O.Id and FI.FIELD = F.ID and THO.ID = FI.Thread group by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,O.ClassCode,F.FieldName,F.Code,F.Id order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName

query.description: What fields (non-static) are shared?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No non-static fields are shared between two or more threads. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (non-static) are shared? --

--

-- Lists all the non-static fields accessed by more than one thread. -- Provides some summary information about the number of reads and -- writes of each field, as well as how many shared objects are created -- that contain this field. Clicking on a field opens its -- declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field
Reads During ConstructionThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
Writes During ConstructionThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
InstancesThe number of shared objects that contain this -- field
Threads InvolvedThe number of threads involved in accessing all -- shared instances of this field
--

--

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows several non-static fields in the --ChatTestClient class. We can see from the --Instances column that only one ChatTestClient --object had these fields accessed by multiple threads. In this one --object, the f_connectedToGameServer field was accessed by --three different threads . It was read twice and written three times, --with one of those writes occurring in the ChatTestClient --constructor. --

--END-INFO select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__|", F.Code "Field__(icon)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) + SUM(FI.ReadCount) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) + SUM(FI.WriteCount) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) "Reads During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) "Writes During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", MAX(FIRC.RC) "Instances__(add-commas)(r)", COUNT(DISTINCT THO.ThreadName) "Threads Involved__(add-commas)(r)", F.Id "FieldId__(hide)" from OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FI, OBJECT THO, (SELECT FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT RECEIVER) "RC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD GROUP BY FIELD) AS FIRC where F.DeclaringType = O.Id and FI.FIELD = F.ID and THO.ID = FI.Thread and FIRC.FIELD = F.ID group by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,O.ClassCode,F.FieldName,F.Id,F.Code order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName

query.description: What fields (non-static) have a non-empty lock set after object construction?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No non-final non-volatile non-static fields that are shared after object construction have a common lock held for each access -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(result-is-good-news) -- Shared fields have a common lock held for each access -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (non-static) have a lock set after object construction? --

--

-- Lists all the non-static fields with a lock set that were accessed by more than -- one thread in the program after object construction. Any reads or writes to the -- field during object construction are not considered. A lock set guarantees that -- the field's data can not be invalidated by a race condition. Provides some -- summary information about the number of reads and writes of each field, as well -- as how many shared objects are created that contain this field. Clicking on a -- field will open its declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsInstancesThe number of objects with a lock set on this field
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows two fields, both reported to have a lock set for --a single instance of the MapView class. --

-- META-END(doc) SELECT O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", FI.FieldName "Field__|", FI.Code "Field__(icon)", LS.COUNT "Instances w/Non-Empty Lock Set__(add-commas)(r)", NOLS.COUNT "Instances w/Empty Lock Set__(r)(add-commas)", FI.ID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM OBJECT O INNER JOIN FIELD FI ON FI.DECLARINGTYPE = O.ID INNER JOIN (SELECT I.FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT I.RECEIVER) "COUNT" FROM INTERESTINGFIELD I, FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET F WHERE F.FIELD = I.FIELD AND F.RECEIVER = I.RECEIVER GROUP BY I.FIELD) LS ON LS.FIELD = FI.ID LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT I.FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT I.RECEIVER) "COUNT" FROM INTERESTINGFIELD I LEFT OUTER JOIN FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET F ON F.FIELD = I.FIELD AND F.RECEIVER = I.RECEIVER WHERE F.LOCK IS NULL AND I.RECEIVER IS NOT NULL GROUP BY I.FIELD) NOLS ON NOLS.FIELD = FI.ID ORDER BY O.PACKAGENAME,O.CLASSNAME,FI.FIELDNAME

query.description: What fields (non-static) have an empty lock set after object construction?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- All non-final non-volatile non-static fields that are shared after object construction have a common lock held for each access -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(result-is-bad-news) -- Shared fields have no common lock held for each access -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (non-static) have an empty lock set after object construction? --

--

-- Lists all the non-static fields with an empty lock set that were accessed by -- more than one thread after object construction. Any reads or writes to the -- field during object construction are not considered. An empty lock set means -- that Flashlight's lock set analysis could not find a common lock held each time -- this field is accessed. Provides some summary information about the number of -- reads and writes of each field, as well as how many shared objects are created -- that contain this field. Clicking on a field will open its declaration in the -- code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsInstancesThe number of objects with a lock set on this field
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows four fields, all of which are reported to have --an empty lock set for a single instance of the MapView class. --

-- META-END(doc) SELECT O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", FI.FieldName "Field__|", FI.Code "Field__(icon)", LS.COUNT "Instances w/Non-Empty Lock Set__(add-commas)(r)", NOLS.COUNT "Instances w/Empty Lock Set__(add-commas)(r)", FI.ID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM OBJECT O INNER JOIN FIELD FI ON FI.DECLARINGTYPE = O.ID INNER JOIN (SELECT I.FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT I.RECEIVER) "COUNT" FROM INTERESTINGFIELD I LEFT OUTER JOIN FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET F ON F.FIELD = I.FIELD AND F.RECEIVER = I.RECEIVER WHERE F.LOCK IS NULL AND I.RECEIVER IS NOT NULL GROUP BY I.FIELD) NOLS ON NOLS.FIELD = FI.ID LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT I.FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT I.RECEIVER) "COUNT" FROM INTERESTINGFIELD I, FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET F WHERE F.FIELD = I.FIELD AND F.RECEIVER = I.RECEIVER GROUP BY I.FIELD) LS ON LS.FIELD = FI.ID ORDER BY O.PACKAGENAME,O.CLASSNAME,FI.FIELDNAME

query.description: What fields (non-static) have writes that do not happen-before subsequent reads?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- All shared non-static field writes happen-before subsequent reads -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(result-is-bad-news) -- Shared fields have writes that do not happen-before subsequent reads -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (non-static) have writes that do not happen-before subsequent reads? --

--

--Lists all fields that could not be shown to have a happens-before relationship between every consecutive access in the program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsCountThe number of instances of this field with no detected happens-before relationship in the program.
--

-- META-END SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", F.FIELDNAME "Field__|", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", COUNT(B.RECEIVER) "Count__(add-commas)(r)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM BADHAPPENSBEFORE B, FIELD F, OBJECT CO WHERE F.ID = B.FIELD AND CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND B.RECEIVER IS NOT NULL GROUP BY CO.PACKAGENAME,CO.CLASSNAME,CO.CLASSCODE,F.FIELDNAME,F.CODE,F.ID

query.description: What fields (non-static) have writes that happen-before subsequent reads?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No shared non-static field writes happen-before subsequent reads -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (non-static) have writes that happen-before subsequent reads? --

--

--Lists all fields that can be shown to have a happens-before relationship between every consecutive access in the program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsCountThe number of instances of this field with a valid happens-before relationship in the program.
--

-- META-END SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", F.FIELDNAME "Field__|", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", COUNT(FI.RECEIVER) "Count__(add-commas)(r)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM FIELDINSTANCESHARED FI LEFT OUTER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD IF ON IF.FIELD = FI.FIELD AND IF.RECEIVER = FI.RECEIVER INNER JOIN FIELD F ON F.ID = FI.FIELD INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE LEFT OUTER JOIN BADHAPPENSBEFORE B ON B.FIELD = FI.FIELD AND B.RECEIVER = FI.RECEIVER WHERE B.FIELD IS NULL OR (IF.FIELD IS NULL AND F.VOLATILE = 'Y') GROUP BY CO.PACKAGENAME,CO.CLASSNAME,CO.CLASSCODE,F.FIELDNAME,F.CODE,F.ID

query.description: What fields (non-static, non-final) are shared?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No non-static fields are shared between two or more threads. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (non-static, non-final) are shared? --

--

-- Lists all the non-static, non-final fields accessed by more than one -- thread. Provides some summary information about the number of reads -- and writes of each field, as well as how many shared objects are -- created that contain this field. Clicking on a field will open its -- declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field
Reads During ConstructionThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
Writes During ConstructionThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
InstancesThe number of shared objects that contain this -- field
Threads InvolvedThe number of threads involved in accessing all -- shared instances of this field
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows two non-static, non-final fields - one in the --GameMap class and one in the Planet class. --We can see from the Instances column that only one --GameMap object had these fields accessed by multiple --threads, whereas 30 different Planet objects are accessed --by multiple threads. In the one GameMap object, the --f_endOfTurnObservers field was accessed by two different --threads. It was read 34 times and written one time in the --GameMap constructor. --

--END-INFO select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__|", F.Code "Field__(icon)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) + SUM(FI.ReadCount) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) + SUM(FI.WriteCount) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) "Reads During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) "Writes During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", MAX(FIRC.RC) "Instances__(add-commas)(r)", COUNT(DISTINCT THO.ThreadName) "Threads Involved__(add-commas)(r)", F.Id "FieldId__(hide)" from OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FI, OBJECT THO, (SELECT FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT RECEIVER) "RC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD GROUP BY FIELD) AS FIRC where F.DeclaringType = O.Id and F.Final = 'N' and FI.FIELD = F.ID and THO.ID = FI.Thread and FIRC.FIELD = F.ID group by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,O.ClassCode,F.FieldName,F.Code,F.Id order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName

query.description: What fields (static) are shared?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No static fields are shared between two or more threads. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (static) are shared? --

--

-- Lists all of the static fields in the program accessed by more than -- one thread, and the number of reads and writes made by each thread. -- Clicking on a field will open its declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsRead CountThe number of times this field was read in this thread
Write CountThe number of times this field was written in this thread
Threads InvolvedThe number of threads involved in accessing this resource
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows one static field - INSTANCE - that --is shared across multiple threads. INSTANCE is found in --the GameMap class, and was accessed by four different threads --during this Flashlight run. --

--END-INFO select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__]", F.Code "Field__(icon)", THO.ThreadName "Thread__('thread.gif')|", FS.ReadCount "Read Count__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", FS.WriteCount "Write Count__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", THO.ThreadName "Threads Involved__(add-commas)(count distinct replace-value-with ' ')(r)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)" from OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDSTATICTHREAD FS, OBJECT THO where F.DeclaringType = O.Id and FS.FIELD = F.ID and THO.ID = FS.Thread order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName,THO.ThreadName

query.description: What fields (static) have a non-empty lock set?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No non-final non-volatile static fields that are shared have a common lock held for each access. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (static) have a lock set? --

--

-- Lists all of the static fields in the program accessed by more than -- one thread that have a lock set, and the number of reads and writes -- made by each thread. A lock set guarantees that the field's data -- cannot be invalidated by a race condition. Clicking on a field will -- open its declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsLockThe identifier of a lock in this field's lock set
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows the static field copyComponents in --the EditBus class. A lock on a particular --ArrayList object is always acquired before this field is --accessed. --

--END-INFO SELECT O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", FI.FieldName "Field", FI.Code "Field__(icon)", OBJID(F.LOCK) "Lock__|", F.LOCK "Lock__(hide)", I.FIELD "FieldId__(hide)" FROM OBJECT O INNER JOIN FIELD FI ON FI.DeclaringType = O.Id INNER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD I ON I.RECEIVER IS NULL AND I.FIELD=FI.ID INNER JOIN FIELDLOCKSET F ON F.FIELD = I.FIELD ORDER BY O.PackageName,O.ClassName,FI.FieldName

query.description: What fields (static) have an empty lock set?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=All non-final non-volatile static fields that are shared have a common lock held for each access. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (static) have an empty lock set? --

--

-- Lists all of the static fields in the program accessed by more than -- one thread that have an empty lock set, and the number of reads and -- writes made by each thread. An empty lock set means that -- Flashlight's lock set analysis could not find a common lock held -- each time this field is accessed. Clicking on a field will open its -- declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows two static fields with no lock set - --checkedForManager in BshClassManager --and debug in Interpreter. --

--END-INFO SELECT O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", FI.FieldName "Field__|", FI.Code "Field__(icon)", I.FIELD "FieldId__(hide)" FROM OBJECT O INNER JOIN FIELD FI ON FI.DeclaringType = O.Id INNER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD I ON I.RECEIVER IS NULL AND I.FIELD=FI.ID LEFT OUTER JOIN FIELDLOCKSET F ON F.FIELD = I.FIELD WHERE F.LOCK IS NULL ORDER BY O.PackageName,O.ClassName,FI.FieldName

query.description: What fields (static) have writes that do not happen-before subsequent reads?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- All shared static field writes happen-before subsequent reads -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(result-is-bad-news) -- Shared static fields have writes that do not happen-before subsequent reads -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (static) have writes that do not happen-before subsequent reads? --

--

--Lists all fields that could not be shown to have a happens-before relationship --between every adjacent access in the program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
--

-- META-END SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", F.FIELDNAME "Field__|", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM BADHAPPENSBEFORE B, FIELD F, OBJECT CO WHERE F.ID = B.FIELD AND CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND B.RECEIVER IS NULL ORDER BY 1,2,4

query.description: What fields (static) have writes that happen-before subsequent reads?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No shared static field writes happen-before subsequent reads -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (static) have writes that happen-before subsequent reads? --

--

--Lists all fields that can be shown to have a happens-before relationship between every adjacent access in the program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
--

-- META-END SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", F.FIELDNAME "Field__|", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)" FROM FIELD F LEFT OUTER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD IF ON F.ID = IF.FIELD INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE LEFT OUTER JOIN BADHAPPENSBEFORE B ON B.FIELD = IF.FIELD WHERE F.STATIC = 'Y' AND ((IF.FIELD IS NOT NULL AND B.FIELD IS NULL) OR (IF.FIELD IS NULL AND F.VOLATILE = 'Y')) ORDER BY 1,2,4

query.description: What fields (static, non-final) are shared?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No static, non-final fields are shared between two or more threads. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (static, non-final) are shared? --

--

-- Lists all of the static, non-final fields in the program accessed by -- more than one thread, and the number of reads and writes made by -- each thread. Clicking on a field will open its declarations in the -- code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsRead CountThe number of times this field was read in this thread
Write CountThe number of times this field was written in this thread
Threads InvolvedThe number of threads involved in accessing this resource
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows one static field - --LOGICAL_MAP_HEIGHT - that is shared across multiple --threads. LOGICAL_MAP_HEIGHT is found in the --Common class, and is accessed by the 'Thread-4', --'Thread-5', and 'main' threads. --

--END-INFO select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__]", F.Code "Field__(icon)", THO.ThreadName "Thread__('thread.gif')|", FS.ReadCount "Read Count__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", FS.WriteCount "Write Count__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", THO.ThreadName "Threads Involved__(add-commas)(count distinct replace-value-with ' ')(r)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)" from OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDSTATICTHREAD FS, OBJECT THO where F.DeclaringType = O.Id and F.Final = 'N' and FS.FIELD = F.ID and THO.ID = FS.Thread order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName,THO.ThreadName

query.description: What fields are accessed in this thread?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No non-static fields were accessed in this thread -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields (non-static) are accessed in this thread? --

--

--Lists all fields that were accessed at some point in the given thread. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field made in this thread
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field made in this thread
Reads During ConstructionThe read count of all shared instances of this field made in this -- thread while the owning object was under construction
Writes During ConstructionThe write count of all shared instances of this field made in this -- thread while the owning object was under construction
InstancesThe number of shared objects that contain this -- field
--

-- META-END select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__|", F.Code "Field__(icon)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) + SUM(FI.ReadCount) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) + SUM(FI.WriteCount) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) "Reads During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) "Writes During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2)(r)", MAX(FIRC.RC) "Instances__(add-commas)(r)", OBJID(?Thread?) "In Thread__('thread.gif')", F.Id "FieldId__(hide)" from OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FI, OBJECT THO, (SELECT FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT RECEIVER) "RC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD GROUP BY FIELD) AS FIRC where F.DeclaringType = O.Id and FI.FIELD = F.ID and THO.ID = FI.Thread and FIRC.FIELD = F.ID AND FI.THREAD = ?Thread? group by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,O.ClassCode,F.FieldName,F.Id,F.Code order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName

query.description: What fields are accessed while this lock is held?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No accesses occur while this lock is held --BEGIN-INFO --

-- Where are fields accessed during this particular lock acquisition? --

--

-- Lists all of the places in the program where a field is held during -- this and only this time the lock is acquired. Clicking on a line -- will open it in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--In the above example, fields were accessed on four different lines of --code in the GameMap class during this particular --acquisition of the given lock. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", S.LOCATION "Method", S.LOCATIONCODE "Method__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__|(r)", SUM(RA.READS) "Reads", SUM(WA.WRITES) "Writes", MIN(A.AMIN) "First Access", MAX(A.AMAX) "Last Access", CASE WHEN SUM(A.ACOUNT) > 1 THEN 'GO' ELSE NULL END "Multiple__(hide)", CASE WHEN SUM(A.ACOUNT) = 1 THEN MAX(A.TRACE) ELSE NULL END "ATRACE__(hide)" FROM (SELECT A.TRACE, MIN(A.TS) "AMIN", MAX(A.TS) "AMAX", COUNT(A.TS) "ACOUNT" FROM (SELECT A.TRACE, A.TS FROM LOCK L, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A WHERE L.LOCKTRACE = ?LOCKTRACE? AND L.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = L.ID AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS UNION SELECT A.TRACE, A.TS FROM LOCK L, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A WHERE L.LOCKTRACE = ?LOCKTRACE? AND L.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' AND LH.LOCKHELDEVENT = L.ID AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = LH.LOCKEVENT AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS) AS A GROUP BY A.TRACE) AS A LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT A.TRACE, COUNT(A.TS) "WRITES" FROM (SELECT A.TRACE, A.TS FROM LOCK L, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A WHERE L.LOCKTRACE = ?LOCKTRACE? AND L.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = L.ID AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND A.RW = 'W' UNION SELECT A.TRACE, A.TS FROM LOCK L, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A WHERE L.LOCKTRACE = ?LOCKTRACE? AND L.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' AND LH.LOCKHELDEVENT = L.ID AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = LH.LOCKEVENT AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND A.RW = 'W') AS A GROUP BY A.TRACE) AS WA ON WA.TRACE = A.TRACE LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT A.TRACE, COUNT(A.TS) "READS" FROM (SELECT A.TRACE, A.TS FROM LOCK L, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A WHERE L.LOCKTRACE = ?LOCKTRACE? AND L.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = L.ID AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND A.RW = 'R' UNION SELECT A.TRACE, A.TS FROM LOCK L, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A WHERE L.LOCKTRACE = ?LOCKTRACE? AND L.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' AND LH.LOCKHELDEVENT = L.ID AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = LH.LOCKEVENT AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND A.RW = 'R') AS A GROUP BY A.TRACE) AS RA ON RA.TRACE = A.TRACE INNER JOIN TRACE T ON T.ID = A.TRACE INNER JOIN SITE S ON S.ID = T.SITE INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = S.INCLASS GROUP BY CO.PACKAGENAME, CO.CLASSNAME, CO.CLASSCODE, S.LOCATION, S.LOCATIONCODE, S.ATLINE ORDER BY CO.PACKAGENAME,CO.CLASSNAME,S.LOCATION,S.ATLINE

query.description: What fields are protected by this lock, and how often?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No accesses occur while this lock is held --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (non-static) are protected by this lock, and how often? --

--

-- Lists all of the fields that were accessed while this lock was held -- and how often each was accessed with or without the lock being held. -- Clicking on a field will open its declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsTimes HeldThe number of times the lock was held while this field -- was accessed
Total AccessesThe total number of accesses made to this field
%The proportion of times the lock was held to the total -- number of field accesses, expressed as a percentage
--

--

Example

-- --

--The above example shows two fields in EditBus, --components and copyComponents, that are --sometimes accessed while this lock is held. One of the fields, --copyComponents, is always accessed while the given lock is --held and therefore has the field as part of its lock set. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT DT.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", DT.CLASSNAME "Class", DT.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", F.FIELDNAME "Field__|", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)", CAST ((CAST (FA.HELD AS FLOAT) / CAST (COUNT(A.ID) AS FLOAT) * 100) AS DECIMAL) "% Held__(suffix '%')(r)", OBJID(?Lock?) "Lock__('lock.gif')", FA.HELD "Accesses With Lock Held__(add-commas)(r)", COUNT(A.ID) "Total Accesses__(add-commas)(r)" FROM (SELECT A.FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT A.ID) "HELD" FROM (SELECT ALH.ACCESS FROM LOCK L, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH WHERE L.LOCK = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = L.ID UNION SELECT ALH.ACCESS FROM LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH WHERE LH.LOCKHELD = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = LH.LOCKEVENT) AS AIDS, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = AIDS.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD GROUP BY A.FIELD) AS FA, FIELD F, ACCESS A, OBJECT DT WHERE F.ID = FA.FIELD AND A.FIELD = F.ID AND DT.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND F.STATIC = 'N' GROUP BY DT.PACKAGENAME,DT.CLASSNAME,DT.CLASSCODE,F.FIELDNAME,F.CODE,F.ID,FA.HELD ORDER BY 1,2,4

query.description: What fields are read by the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and written in others?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No fields read by the AWT Event Dispatch Thread were modified outside of it -- META-END -- NOTE: We do not want a "good news" msg because the program may not use AWT/Swing -- META-BEGIN(result-is-bad-news) -- Fields read by the AWT Event Dispatch Thread were modified outside of it -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What fields are read by the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and written in others? --

--

-- The Swing and AWT libraries mandate that all modifications -- to their components happen in the AWT Event Dispatch Thread. -- Flashlight does not currently instrument the Swing and AWT -- libraries, so it cannot detect all violations of this -- policy. What this query provides is a synopsis of all of -- your program's fields that are read while in the AWT Event -- Dispath Thread but modified outside it. This can give you a -- general idea as to what portions of the program interact -- with Swing and AWT and can help identify violations of the -- threading policy. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field
Reads During ConstructionThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
Writes During ConstructionThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field made while the owning object was under -- construction
InstancesThe number of shared objects that contain this -- field
Threads InvolvedThe number of threads involved in accessing all -- shared instances of this field
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

-- The above example shows four fields that are read both inside and -- outsied of the AWT Event Dispatch Thread. We can see from the -- Threads Involved column that two different threads, one being -- the AWT Event Dispatch Thread, accessed these fields in the -- ChatTestClient class had these fields accessed by multiple -- threads. It was read nine times and and written one times, with one of -- those writes occurring in the ChatTestClient constructor. --

-- META-END SELECT O.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", O.CLASSNAME "Class", O.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", F.FIELDNAME "Field__|", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) + SUM(FI.ReadCount) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) + SUM(FI.WriteCount) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", SUM(FI.ReadUCCount) "Reads During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", SUM(FI.WriteUCCount) "Writes During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", COUNT(DISTINCT THO.ThreadName) "Threads Involved__(add-commas)(r)", F.Id "FieldId__(hide)" FROM (SELECT DISTINCT A.FIELD,A.RECEIVER FROM OBJECT O, ACCESS A WHERE O.FLAG='T' AND O.THREADNAME LIKE 'AWT-EventQueue%' AND A.INTHREAD = O.ID AND A.RECEIVER IS NOT NULL INTERSECT SELECT DISTINCT A.FIELD,A.RECEIVER FROM OBJECT O, ACCESS A WHERE O.FLAG='T' AND O.THREADNAME NOT LIKE 'AWT-EventQueue%' AND A.INTHREAD = O.ID AND A.RECEIVER IS NOT NULL AND A.RW = 'W') AS MIXEDAWT,OBJECT O,FIELD F, FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FI, OBJECT THO WHERE F.ID = MIXEDAWT.FIELD AND F.VOLATILE = 'N' AND O.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND FI.FIELD = MIXEDAWT.FIELD AND FI.RECEIVER = MIXEDAWT.RECEIVER AND THO.ID = FI.Thread GROUP BY O.PACKAGENAME,O.CLASSNAME,O.CLASSCODE,F.FIELDNAME,F.CODE,F.ID ORDER BY O.PACKAGENAME,O.CLASSNAME,F.FIELDNAME

query.description: What fields could produce false sharing with this field in the object?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields could produce false sharing with this field in the object? --

 --

--Lists the other fields in the object that were accessed during the period of --time in which the analysis suspected false sharing might be going on. A high --interleaving % indicates how often accesses of the field occurred in between --accesses of the given thread. A higher percentage indicates a higher risk of --false sharing negatively impacting performances in this program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Object → Field → Interleaver →Thread
ColumnsReadsThe number of times this field was read in this thread
WritesThe number of times this field was written in this thread
Interleaving %The frequency with which accesses to this field occurred in between accesses of the given field during this period of time
StartThe time of the first field access in this block.
StopThe time of the last field access in this block.
--

--END-INFO SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", OBJID(B.RECEIVER) "Object", F.FIELDNAME "Field", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", RF.FIELDNAME "Interleaver", RF.CODE "Interleaver__(icon)", OBJID(B.INTHREAD) "Thread__('thread.gif')|", B.READS "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", B.WRITES "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", B.QUOTIENT "Interleaving %__(suffix '%')(r)", B.START "Start", B.STOP "Stop", B.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)", RF.ID "RFieldId__(hide)" FROM FIELDBLOCKSTATS B, FIELD F, FIELD RF, OBJECT CO WHERE F.ID = B.FIELD AND CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND RF.ID = B.RFIELD AND B.START = '?Start?' AND B.STOP = '?Stop?' ORDER BY CO.PACKAGENAME, CO.CLASSNAME, B.RECEIVER, F.FIELDNAME, RF.FIELDNAME

query.description: What happens before edges allow these field reads to see the previous write?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No happens before edges were detected. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What happens before edges allow these field reads to see the previous write? --

 --

--Lists all happens-before edges that ensure that any changes in the previous --access block are visible to this access block. The edge guarantees that actions --taken before the source time in the source thread are visible by the target time --in the target thread. Note that no entries does not mean that there is a --problem. For instances, it may be the case that this access block begins for --with a field write, and so does not have to worry about the previous accesses --being visible. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsSource ThreadThe originating thread for this happens-before edge
Source TimeAll accesses in the source thread made before this time are affected by this edge
Target ThreadThe target thread for this happens-before edge
Target TimeThe time at which changes made in the source thread become visible to the target thread
--

--END-INFO SELECT HB.ID "Type", '?Thread?' "Source Thread__('thread.gif')", HB.SOURCETS "Source Time", SCO.CLASSNAME "Source Class", SCO.CLASSCODE "Source Class__(icon)", SS.LOCATION "Source Method", SS.LOCATIONCODE "Source Method__(icon)", OBJID(?LastWriteThread?) "Target Thread__('thread.gif')", HB.TRACETS "Target Time", TCO.CLASSNAME "Target Class", TCO.CLASSCODE "Target Class__(icon)", TS.LOCATION "Target Method", TS.LOCATIONCODE "Target Method__(icon)", HB.SOURCEID "SOURCEID__(hide)", HB.TRACEID "TRACEID__(hide)", HB.SOURCETS "SOURCETS__(hide)", HB.TRACETS "TRACETS__(hide)" FROM TABLE (HAPPENSBEFOREEDGES(?LastWriteThread?, '?LastWriteTime?',?ThreadId?,'?Start?')) HB INNER JOIN TRACE ST ON ST.ID = HB.SOURCEID INNER JOIN SITE SS ON SS.ID = ST.SITE INNER JOIN OBJECT SCO ON SCO.ID = SS.INCLASS LEFT OUTER JOIN TRACE TT ON TT.ID = HB.TRACEID LEFT OUTER JOIN SITE TS ON TS.ID = TT.SITE LEFT OUTER JOIN OBJECT TCO ON TCO.ID = TS.INCLASS

query.description: What individual accesses of this field occur while this lock is held?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT '?Package?' "Package__('@PK')", '?Class?' "Class", '?Class (Image)?' "Class__(icon)", '?Method?' "Method", '?Method (Image)?' "Method__(icon)", '?Line?' "Line", A.TS "Time__|", CASE WHEN A.RW = 'R' THEN 'Read' ELSE 'Write' END "Access", CASE WHEN A.UNDERCONSTRUCTION = 'N' THEN ' ' ELSE 'Yes' END "Under Construction__(c)", '?Multiple?' "Multiple__(hide)", A.ID "AID__(hide)", A.TRACE "ATRACE__(hide)" FROM LOCKDURATION D, ACCESS A, OBJECT THO, TRACE T, SITE S, OBJECT CO WHERE D.STARTEVENT = ?LockEvent? AND A.TS BETWEEN D.START AND D.STOP AND A.INTHREAD = D.INTHREAD AND T.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = T.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS AND THO.ID = A.INTHREAD AND S.ATLINE = ?Line? AND S.LOCATION = '?Method?' AND CO.CLASSNAME = '?Class?' AND CO.PACKAGENAME = '?Package?' ORDER BY A.TS ASC

query.description: What instances contain this field and are accessed in this thread?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What instances of this non-static field are accessed in this thread? --

--

--Lists all objects containing an instance of this field that is accessed in the given thread. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsObjectAn object identifier
ReadsThe read count of the field on this object
WritesThe write count of the field on this object
Reads Under ConstructionThe read count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Writes Under ConstructionThe write count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Lock Set SizeThe number of locks commonly held when each access is -- made to the field on this object
--

--END-INFO SELECT OBJID(COUNTS.RECEIVER) "Instance", CO.CLASSCODE "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", COUNTS.READS + COUNTS.READSUC "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITES + COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", OBJID(?Thread?) "In Thread__('thread.gif')", CASE WHEN EXISTS (SELECT * FROM FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? AND RECEIVER = COUNTS.RECEIVER) THEN 'Non-Empty' ELSE 'Empty' END "Lock Set", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", COUNTS.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM (SELECT RECEIVER, SUM(READCOUNT) "READS", SUM(WRITECOUNT) "WRITES", SUM(READUCCOUNT) "READSUC", SUM(WRITEUCCOUNT) "WRITESUC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? AND THREAD = ?Thread? GROUP BY RECEIVER) AS COUNTS LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT RECEIVER, COUNT(LOCK) "COUNT" FROM FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY RECEIVER) AS LOCKS ON COUNTS.RECEIVER = LOCKS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = COUNTS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE

query.description: What instances contain this field and are shared after object construction?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What instances of this non-static field are shared after object construction? --

--

-- Lists the shared objects containing a given field. The number of -- reads/writes and the size of the lock set is also shown. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsField ObjectAn object identifier
ReadsThe read count of the field on this object
WritesThe write count of the field on this object
Reads Under ConstructionThe read count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Writes Under ConstructionThe write count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Lock Set SizeThe number of locks commonly held when each access is -- made to the field on this object
--

--

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows a number of objects containing the --f_lock field recorded during this Flashlight run. We can --see from the names of the objects that both Planet and ship contain the --f_lock field. This is because f_lock is --declared in an abstract class called Thing. In addition to --the number of reads and writes recorded for each object, the size of --f_lock's lock set is shown. It is important to note that a --lock set size of zero does not mean that there is a potential --race condition for this field. The queries that specifically detect --empty lock sets check for additional things, like whether the field is --volatile or static, and whether the field is written to outside of --the constructor. Any of these indicators could make it perfectly --acceptable for the field to have a lock set size of zero. If you want --to get the fields that Flashlight reports as having an empty lock set, --instead run What instances of this field have an empty lock set? -- --

-- --END-INFO SELECT OBJID(COUNTS.RECEIVER) "Instance", CO.CLASSCODE "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", COUNTS.READS + COUNTS.READSUC "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITES + COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", CASE WHEN LOCKS.COUNT IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE 'Yes' END "Consistently Protected By A Lock After Object Construction", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", COUNTS.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM (SELECT T.RECEIVER, SUM(T.READCOUNT) "READS", SUM(T.WRITECOUNT) "WRITES", SUM(T.READUCCOUNT) "READSUC", SUM(T.WRITEUCCOUNT) "WRITESUC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD T, FIELDINSTANCESHARED S WHERE T.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND S.FIELD = T.FIELD AND S.RECEIVER = T.RECEIVER GROUP BY T.RECEIVER) AS COUNTS LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT RECEIVER, COUNT(LOCK) "COUNT" FROM FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY RECEIVER) AS LOCKS ON COUNTS.RECEIVER = LOCKS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = COUNTS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE

query.description: What instances contain this field and are shared during object construction?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No instances of this field are accessed by multiple threads during object construction. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What instances of this non-static field are shard during object construction? --

--

-- Lists the shared objects containing a given field that are -- improperly published. Improperly published objects are accessed by -- more than one thread while the object is under construction. This -- generally happens when a constructor passes its -- this reference to another object during -- construction. The number of reads/writes and the size of the lock -- set is also shown. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsField ObjectAn object identifier
ReadsThe read count of the field on this object
WritesThe write count of the field on this object
Reads Under ConstructionThe read count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Writes Under ConstructionThe write count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Lock Set SizeThe number of locks commonly held when each access is -- made to the field on this object
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--In the above example, Flashlight has observed that the --state field in ZooKeeper-663 may be --improperly published. --

--

--It is important to note that the query does not prove that the --state field was improperly published. It may be that there --is a happens-before event of some sort between the reads and writes of --each field. This would be the case if a thread was initialized in a --constructor and this was passed into the new thread. If --the state of this is not modified afterwards, then there is --no danger that the program will behave unexpectedly. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT OBJID(COUNTS.RECEIVER) "Instance", CO.CLASSCODE "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", COUNTS.READS + COUNTS.READSUC "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITES + COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", CASE WHEN LOCKS.COUNT IS NULL THEN 0 ELSE LOCKS.COUNT END "Lock Set Size__(r)", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", COUNTS.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM BADPUBLISH BP INNER JOIN (SELECT RECEIVER, SUM(READCOUNT) "READS", SUM(WRITECOUNT) "WRITES", SUM(READUCCOUNT) "READSUC", SUM(WRITEUCCOUNT) "WRITESUC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY RECEIVER) AS COUNTS ON COUNTS.RECEIVER = BP.RECEIVER AND BP.FIELD = ?FieldId? LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT RECEIVER, COUNT(LOCK) "COUNT" FROM FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY RECEIVER) AS LOCKS ON COUNTS.RECEIVER = LOCKS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = COUNTS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE

query.description: What instances contain this field and have a bad happens-before relationship?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

--What instances of this field have a bad happens-before relationship? --

 --

--Lists all objects containing this field that may not be protected properly by happens-before relationships. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsObjectAn object containing this field
ReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field made in this thread
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field made in this thread
Reads Under ConstructionThe read count of all shared instances of this field made in this -- thread while the owning object was under construction
Writes Under ConstructionThe write count of all shared instances of this field made in this -- thread while the owning object was under construction
--

--END-INFO SELECT OBJID(FIT.RECEIVER) "Instance", MAX(CO.CLASSCODE) "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", SUM(FIT.READCOUNT) + SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITECOUNT) + SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", FIT.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FIT INNER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD IF ON IF.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND IF.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN BADHAPPENSBEFORE B ON B.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND B.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE WHERE FIT.FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY FIT.RECEIVER ORDER BY 1

query.description: What instances contain this field and have a good happens-before relationship?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

--What instances of this field have a good happens-before relationship? --

 --

--Lists all objects containing this field that can be shown to be protected by happens-before relationships. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsObjectAn object containing this field
ReadsThe read count of all shared instances of this -- field made in this thread
WritesThe write count of all shared instances of this -- field made in this thread
Reads Under ConstructionThe read count of all shared instances of this field made in this -- thread while the owning object was under construction
Writes Under ConstructionThe write count of all shared instances of this field made in this -- thread while the owning object was under construction
--

--END-INFO SELECT OBJID(FIT.RECEIVER) "Instance", MAX(CO.CLASSCODE) "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", SUM(FIT.READCOUNT) + SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITECOUNT) + SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", FIT.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM FIELD F INNER JOIN FIELDINSTANCESHARED FIS ON FIS.FIELD = F.ID INNER JOIN FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FIT ON FIT.FIELD = FIS.FIELD AND FIT.RECEIVER = FIS.RECEIVER LEFT OUTER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD IF ON IF.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND IF.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER LEFT OUTER JOIN BADHAPPENSBEFORE B ON B.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND B.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE WHERE F.ID = ?FieldId? AND (B.RECEIVER IS NULL OR (IF.FIELD IS NULL AND F.VOLATILE = 'Y')) GROUP BY FIT.RECEIVER ORDER BY 1

query.description: What instances contain this field and have a non-empty lock set?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT OBJID(FIT.RECEIVER) "Instance", MAX(CO.CLASSCODE) "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", SUM(FIT.READCOUNT) + SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITECOUNT) + SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", 'Non-Empty' "Lock Set", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", FIT.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)", ?Instances w/Non-Empty Lock Set? "Required__(hide)" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FIT INNER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD IF ON IF.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND IF.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT FIELD, RECEIVER FROM FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET) FIL ON FIL.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND FIL.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE WHERE FIT.FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY FIT.RECEIVER ORDER BY 1

query.description: What instances contain this field and have an empty lock set?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What instances of this field have an empty lock set? --

--

-- Lists the objects containing the given field that are -- accessed by more than one thread in the program and have no -- lock set. The number of reads/writes is also shown. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsField ObjectAn object identifier
ReadsThe read count of the field on this object
WritesThe write count of the field on this object
Reads Under ConstructionThe read count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Writes Under ConstructionThe write count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
--

--

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows a single Ship object containing the --f_location field. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT OBJID(FIT.RECEIVER) "Instance", MAX(CO.CLASSCODE) "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", SUM(FIT.READCOUNT) + SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITECOUNT) + SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.READUCCOUNT) "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", SUM(FIT.WRITEUCCOUNT) "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", 'Empty' "Lock Set", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", FIT.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)", ?Instances w/Empty Lock Set? "Required__(hide)" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FIT INNER JOIN INTERESTINGFIELD IF ON IF.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND IF.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER LEFT OUTER JOIN FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET FIL ON FIL.FIELD = FIT.FIELD AND FIL.RECEIVER = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = FIT.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE WHERE FIT.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND FIL.LOCK IS NULL GROUP BY FIT.RECEIVER ORDER BY 1

query.description: What instances contain this field when it is read by the AWT Event Dispatch Thread and written in others?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT OBJID(COUNTS.RECEIVER) "Instance", CO.CLASSCODE "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", COUNTS.READS + COUNTS.READSUC "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITES + COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", CASE WHEN LS.RECEIVER IS NULL THEN 'Empty' ELSE 'Non-Empty' END "Lock Set", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", COUNTS.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM (SELECT RECEIVER, SUM(READCOUNT) "READS", SUM(WRITECOUNT) "WRITES", SUM(READUCCOUNT) "READSUC", SUM(WRITEUCCOUNT) "WRITESUC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY RECEIVER) AS COUNTS LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT RECEIVER FROM FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId?) AS LS ON LS.RECEIVER = COUNTS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = COUNTS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE INNER JOIN (SELECT A.RECEIVER FROM OBJECT O, ACCESS A WHERE O.FLAG = 'T' AND O.THREADNAME LIKE 'AWT-EventQueue%' AND A.INTHREAD = O.ID AND A.RECEIVER IS NOT NULL INTERSECT SELECT A.RECEIVER FROM OBJECT O, ACCESS A WHERE O.FLAG='T' AND O.THREADNAME NOT LIKE 'AWT-EventQueue%' AND A.INTHREAD = O.ID AND A.RECEIVER IS NOT NULL AND A.RW = 'W') MIXEDAWT ON MIXEDAWT.RECEIVER = COUNTS.RECEIVER

query.description: What instances contain this field?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What are the instances of this non-static field? --

--

-- Lists the shared objects containing a given field. The number of -- reads/writes and the size of the lock set is also shown. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsField ObjectAn object identifier
ReadsThe read count of the field on this object
WritesThe write count of the field on this object
Reads Under ConstructionThe read count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Writes Under ConstructionThe write count of the field on this object while it was -- being initialized
Lock Set SizeThe number of locks commonly held when each access is -- made to the field on this object
--

--

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example shows a number of objects containing the --f_lock field recorded during this Flashlight run. We can --see from the names of the objects that both Planet and ship contain the --f_lock field. This is because f_lock is --declared in an abstract class called Thing. In addition to --the number of reads and writes recorded for each object, the size of --f_lock's lock set is shown. It is important to note that a --lock set size of zero does not mean that there is a potential --race condition for this field. The queries that specifically detect --empty lock sets check for additional things, like whether the field is --volatile or static, and whether the field is written to outside of --the constructor. Any of these indicators could make it perfectly --acceptable for the field to have a lock set size of zero. If you want --to get the fields that Flashlight reports as having an empty lock set, --instead run What instances of this field have an empty lock set? -- --

--META-END SELECT OBJID(COUNTS.RECEIVER) "Instance", CO.CLASSCODE "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", COUNTS.READS + COUNTS.READSUC "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITES + COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", COUNTS.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", CASE WHEN LS.RECEIVER IS NULL THEN 'Empty' ELSE 'Non-Empty' END "Lock Set", ?FieldId? "FieldId__(hide)", COUNTS.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM (SELECT RECEIVER, SUM(READCOUNT) "READS", SUM(WRITECOUNT) "WRITES", SUM(READUCCOUNT) "READSUC", SUM(WRITEUCCOUNT) "WRITESUC" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId? GROUP BY RECEIVER) AS COUNTS LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT RECEIVER FROM FIELDINSTANCELOCKSET WHERE FIELD = ?FieldId?) AS LS ON LS.RECEIVER = COUNTS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.ID = COUNTS.RECEIVER INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = O.TYPE

query.description: What instances of this class are indirectly accessed by more than one thread?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What instances of this class are indirectly accessed by more than one thread? --

--

-- Lists the objects in this class called by more than one thread, and -- gives a breakdown of the accesses made by each thread. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructureObject → Thread
ColumnsAccessesThe number of times this object was indirectly accessed -- in this thread
--

--

Example

-- --

--The above example lists the one instance of HashSet that --was indirectly accessed by more than one thread in this Flashlight run. --The main, Thread-4, Thread-2, and --Thread-5 threads were all observed to indirectly access --this particular HashSet. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT OBJID(IA.RECEIVER) "Object", THO.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')|", COUNT (IA.ID) "Accesses__(add-commas)(r)", IA.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM (SELECT IA.RECEIVER FROM OBJECT C, OBJECT R, INDIRECTACCESS IA WHERE C.PACKAGENAME = '?Package?' AND C.CLASSNAME = '?Class?' AND R.TYPE = C.ID AND IA.RECEIVER = R.ID GROUP BY IA.RECEIVER HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT IA.INTHREAD) > 1) AS R, INDIRECTACCESS IA, OBJECT THO WHERE IA.RECEIVER = R.RECEIVER AND THO.ID = IA.INTHREAD GROUP BY IA.RECEIVER, THO.THREADNAME ORDER BY 1, 3 DESC

query.description: What is the lock trace?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What is the lock trace for this lock event? --

--

-- Generates a trace of the lock acquisitions that were made leading up -- to this lock event, from most to least recent. Clicking on each -- entry will open up the line that acquired that lock in the code -- view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsLockThe lock acquired in this line of the trace
PackageThe package this lock was acquired in
ClassThe class this lock was acquired in
LineThe line number this lock was acquired at
TimeThe time this lock was acquired
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example shows the locks acquired by the end of the given lock --event. The ReentrantReadWriteLock-16 lock is acquired at --line 104 of GameMap, followed by the --Object-523 lock at line 422 of MapView. The --times of both lock acquisitions are also noted. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT OBJID(D.Lock) "Lock__('lock.gif')(r)", D.Lock "Lock__(hide)", LO.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", LO.ClassName "Class", LO.Classcode "Class__(icon)", S.Location "Location", S.LocationCode "Location__(icon)", S.AtLine "Line__(r)", D.Start "Acquired__(r)", D.Stop "Released__(r)", D.Duration "Held__(human-readable-duration)(r)", D.ID "LDID__(hide)", LL.TRACE "LATRACE__(hide)" FROM LOCK L, LOCKDURATION D, LOCK LL, TRACE T, SITE S, OBJECT LO WHERE D.InThread = L.InThread AND (L.TS BETWEEN D.START AND D.STOP) AND D.STATE = 'HOLDING' AND LL.Id = D.StartEvent AND T.Id = LL.Trace AND S.Id = T.Site AND LO.Id = S.InClass AND L.Id = ?LockEvent? ORDER BY D.START DESC

query.description: What is the lock trace?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT OBJID(LOCK) "Lock__('lock.gif')", S.PACKAGENAME "Package__('package.gif')", S.CLASSNAME "Class", S.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", S.LOCATION "Location", S.LOCATIONCODE "Location__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__(r)", S.LOCKTRACE "LOCKTRACE__(hide)", S.LOCK "Lock__(hide)", S.TRACE "LATRACE__(hide)" FROM TABLE (LOCKTRACE(?LOCKTRACE?)) S

query.description: What is the stack trace for this edge's source?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What is the stack trace for this edge's source? --

--

-- Generates a stack trace of the method calls leading up to this field -- access or method call, from most to least recent. Clicking on each -- line will open the method call in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsPackageThe package this method invocation or access occurred -- in
ClassThe class this method invocation or access occurred -- in
LocationThe location of this method invocation or access. This -- is generally the enclosing method
FileThe name of the source file this method invocation or -- access occurred in
LineThe line number this method invocation or access occurred at
--

--END-INFO SELECT s.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", s.CLASSNAME "Class", s.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", s.LOCATION "Location", s.LOCATIONCODE "Location__(icon)", s.ATLINE "Line__(r)" FROM TABLE (STACKTRACE(?SOURCEID?)) s
