query.description: What kinds of objects are indirectly accessed by more than one thread?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What kinds of objects are indirectly accessed by more than one thread? --

--

-- Shows all of the classes with objects that are indirectly accessed -- by more than one thread, as well as how many threads call them and -- how many accesses are actually made. Flashlight can generate -- indirect access events about an object whenever it is invoked with -- or passed as a parameter to a particular method. By default, it -- does this for the collections and array manipulation methods in -- java.util and -- java.lang.System. For more information about -- indirect accesses, see . -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class
ColumnsThreadsThe number of threads that indirectly access objects of this class
AccessesThe number of indirect accesses made to objects of this class
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example lists some of the types that were indirectly accessed --by more than one thread. In this Flashlight run, instances of --java.util.BitSet were accessed by two threads a total of --1995 times. To get a breakdown per-object, we would run the query --"What instances of this class are indirectly accessed by more than --one thread?" --

--END-INFO SELECT T.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", T.CLASSNAME "Class__|", T.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", COUNT(DISTINCT THO.THREADNAME) "Threads__(add-commas)('thread.gif')(r)", COUNT (IA.ID) "Accesses__(add-commas)(sum on 3)(r)" FROM (SELECT RECEIVER FROM INDIRECTACCESS GROUP BY RECEIVER HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT INTHREAD) > 1) AS R, INDIRECTACCESS IA, OBJECT O, OBJECT T, OBJECT THO WHERE IA.RECEIVER = R.RECEIVER AND O.ID = IA.RECEIVER AND T.ID = O.TYPE AND THO.ID = IA.INTHREAD GROUP BY T.PACKAGENAME, T.CLASSNAME, T.CLASSCODE ORDER BY 1,2,3,4

query.description: What lock cycles could potentially cause deadlock?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No lock cycles were observed that could cause the program to deadlock -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(empty-is-good-news) -- No lock cycles were observed that could cause the program to deadlock -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(result-is-bad-news) -- Lock cycles were observed that could cause the program to deadlock -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What lock cycles exist? --

--

-- Lists all detected lock cycles in the program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsCycleA cycle identifier
Locks InvolvedThe number of locks involved in this lock cycle
--

-- META-END select COMPONENT "Cycle__('refresh.gif')(r)", COUNT(*) "Number of Locks Involved__(add-commas)(r)" from ( select COMPONENT, OBJID (LOCKHELD) from LOCKCYCLE union distinct select COMPONENT, OBJID (LOCKACQUIRED) from LOCKCYCLE ) as CYCLES group by COMPONENT order by COMPONENT

query.description: What lock edges occured?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT DISTINCT OBJID(H.LOCKHELD) "Held", OBJID(H.LOCKACQUIRED) "Acquired", OBJID(H.INTHREAD) "Thread", COUNT(*) "Count__(add-commas)(r)", H.LOCKHELD "LockHeld__(hide)", H.LOCKACQUIRED "LockAcquired__(hide)" FROM LOCKSHELD H GROUP BY H.LOCKHELD, H.LOCKACQUIRED, H.INTHREAD ORDER BY 3 DESC,1,2

query.description: What locks are acquired by this thread?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What locks are acquired by this thread? --

--

-- Lists all locks that are acquired in this thread at some point in the program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsLockA lock identifier
Times Acquired In ThreadThe number of times this lock was acquired in the thread
Total Block Time In threadThe total measured amount of time this thread spent blocked while waiting to acquire this lock
Average Block Time In ThreadThe average amount of time this lock spent blocked while waiting to acquire this lock
--

--END-INFO SELECT OBJID(LDS.Lock) "Lock__('lock.gif')(c)]", LDS.LOCKCOUNT "Times Acquired__(add-commas)(r)(sum on 1)", LDS.LOCKDURATION "Total Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)(sum on 1)", LDS.LOCKAVERAGE "Average Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", CS.MAXTYPES "Max Classes Accessed__(r)(max)", PS.MAXPACKAGES "Max Packages Accessed__(r)(max)", LDS.Lock "Lock__(hide)" FROM (SELECT LOCK, COUNT(LOCK) "LOCKCOUNT", SUM(DURATION) "LOCKDURATION", SUM(DURATION) / COUNT(LOCK) "LOCKAVERAGE" FROM LOCKDURATION WHERE STATE = 'BLOCKING' AND INTHREAD = ?Thread? GROUP BY LOCK) LDS LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT L.LOCK, MAX(AGG.TYPES) "MAXTYPES" FROM ( SELECT E.EVENT, COUNT(DISTINCT E.DECLARINGTYPE) "TYPES" FROM ( SELECT ALH.LASTACQUISITION "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD AND A.INTHREAD = ?Thread? UNION SELECT LH.LOCKHELDEVENT "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND LH.LOCKEVENT=ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND F.ID = A.FIELD AND A.INTHREAD = ?Thread? ) E GROUP BY E.EVENT ) AGG, LOCK L WHERE L.ID = AGG.EVENT GROUP BY L.LOCK) CS ON CS.LOCK = LDS.LOCK LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT L.LOCK, MAX(AGG.PACKAGES) "MAXPACKAGES" FROM ( SELECT E.EVENT, COUNT(DISTINCT CO.PACKAGENAME) "PACKAGES" FROM ( SELECT ALH.LASTACQUISITION "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD AND A.INTHREAD = ?Thread? UNION SELECT LH.LOCKHELDEVENT "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND LH.LOCKEVENT=ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND F.ID = A.FIELD AND A.INTHREAD = ?Thread? ) E, OBJECT CO WHERE CO.ID = E.DECLARINGTYPE GROUP BY E.EVENT ) AGG, LOCK L WHERE L.ID = AGG.EVENT GROUP BY L.LOCK) PS ON PS.LOCK = LDS.LOCK ORDER BY LDS.LOCKAVERAGE DESC

query.description: What locks are acquired?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT OBJID(LDS.Lock) "Lock__('lock.gif')(c)]", OBJID(LDS.InThread) "Thread__('thread.gif')|", LDS.LOCKCOUNT "Times Acquired__(add-commas)(r)(sum on 1)", LDS.LOCKDURATION "Total Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)(sum on 1)", LDS.LOCKAVERAGE "Average Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", CS.MAXTYPES "Max Classes Accessed__(r)(max)", PS.MAXPACKAGES "Max Packages Accessed__(r)(max)", LDS.Lock "Lock__(hide)", LDS.InThread "Thread__(hide)" FROM (SELECT LOCK, INTHREAD, COUNT(LOCK) "LOCKCOUNT", SUM(DURATION) "LOCKDURATION", SUM(DURATION) / COUNT(LOCK) "LOCKAVERAGE" FROM LOCKDURATION WHERE STATE = 'BLOCKING' GROUP BY LOCK, INTHREAD) LDS LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT L.LOCK, L.INTHREAD, MAX(AGG.TYPES) "MAXTYPES" FROM ( SELECT E.EVENT, COUNT(DISTINCT E.DECLARINGTYPE) "TYPES" FROM ( SELECT ALH.LASTACQUISITION "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD UNION SELECT LH.LOCKHELDEVENT "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND LH.LOCKEVENT=ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND F.ID = A.FIELD ) E GROUP BY E.EVENT ) AGG, LOCK L WHERE L.ID = AGG.EVENT GROUP BY L.LOCK,L.INTHREAD) CS ON CS.LOCK = LDS.LOCK AND CS.INTHREAD = LDS.INTHREAD LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT L.LOCK, L.INTHREAD, MAX(AGG.PACKAGES) "MAXPACKAGES" FROM ( SELECT E.EVENT, COUNT(DISTINCT CO.PACKAGENAME) "PACKAGES" FROM ( SELECT ALH.LASTACQUISITION "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD UNION SELECT LH.LOCKHELDEVENT "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND LH.LOCKEVENT=ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND F.ID = A.FIELD ) E, OBJECT CO WHERE CO.ID = E.DECLARINGTYPE GROUP BY E.EVENT ) AGG, LOCK L WHERE L.ID = AGG.EVENT GROUP BY L.LOCK,L.INTHREAD) PS ON PS.LOCK = LDS.LOCK AND PS.INTHREAD = LDS.INTHREAD ORDER BY LDS.LOCK, LDS.LOCKDURATION DESC

query.description: What locks are contended for the longest time?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No locks were observed to be acquired during this run of the program. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What locks are contended for the longest time? --

--

-- Lists all of the locks in the program, in descending order of the -- average amount of time a lock blocks a thread each time it is -- acquired. Locks with a high average block time usually indicate -- high contention in part of your program, and may be a source of -- slowdown. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsLockA lock identifier
Times AcquiredThe number of times this lock was acquired
Total Block TimeThe total amount of time that threads spent waiting for -- this lock
Average Block TimeThe average amount of time a thread waits before the -- lock was acquired
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example lists some of the locks that were acquired during this --Flashlight run, sorted in descending order by average block time. --Threads acquiring ReentrantReadWriteLock-1256 waited an --average of 72 microseconds before the lock was acquired and the thread --could continue working. We can see that most waited-on lock (on --average) has a significantly smaller block time, so it may be worth --investigating ReentrantReadWriteLock-1256 further to see --what is causing it to wait longer on average. --

--END-INFO select OBJID(Lock) "Lock__('lock.gif')(c)", count(lock) "Times Acquired__(add-commas)(r)", sum(Duration) "Total Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", sum(duration) / count (lock) "Average Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", Lock "Lock__(hide)" from LOCKDURATION where State = 'BLOCKING' group by Lock order by sum(duration) / count (lock) desc

query.description: What locks are held during this field access?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No locks are held during this access of the field. --TODO make this look like a lock trace --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What locks are held during this field access? --

--

-- Displays all of the locks that were held during a particular read or -- write to a field, as well as the time and thread in which the access -- occurred. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructureThread → Time → Lock
ColumnsPackageThe package the lock was acquired in
ClassThe class the lock was acquired in
LineThe line of code the lock was acquired on
--

--

Example

-- --

--In the above example, ReentrantReadWriteLock-1130, --CommandVisitor-1050, and ClientHandler-753 --were all held when Thread-4 accessed this field. --

--END-INFO SELECT O.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')", A.TS "Time", OBJID(D.Lock) "Lock__('lock.gif')|", LO.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", LO.ClassName "Class", LO.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", S.Location "Method", S.LocationCode "Method__(icon)", S.AtLine "Line__(r)", D.ID "LDID__(hide)", A.TRACE "ATRACE__(hide)",L.TRACE "LATRACE__(hide)",D.LOCK "Lock__(hide)" FROM ACCESS A INNER JOIN OBJECT O ON O.Id = A.InThread INNER JOIN LOCKDURATION D ON D.InThread = A.InThread AND (A.TS BETWEEN D.Start AND D.Stop) LEFT OUTER JOIN LOCK L ON L.Id = D.StartEvent LEFT OUTER JOIN TRACE TR ON TR.Id = L.TRACE LEFT OUTER JOIN SITE S ON S.Id = TR.SITE LEFT OUTER JOIN OBJECT LO ON LO.Id = S.InClass WHERE A.ID = ?AID? ORDER BY O.THREADNAME ASC, A.TS ASC, D.Start DESC

query.description: What objects are protected by this lock, and how often?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No accesses occur while this lock is held -- --BEGIN-INFO --

--What objects are protected by this lock, and how often? --

--

--Displays all of the objects that were indirectly accessed while --Flashlight observed the given lock to be held, grouped by package and --class. For each object, the proportion of all indirect access the lock --is actually held for is displayed. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Object
ColumnsTimes HeldThe number of times this object was indirectly accessed while the given lock was held
Total AccessesThe total number of times this object was indirectly accessed
%The percentage of all indirect accesses the given lock was held for
--

--

Example

-- --

--The above example displays three instances of HashSet, all --of which are always protected by the given lock. --

--END-INFO SELECT DT.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", DT.CLASSNAME "Class", DT.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", OBJID(A.RECEIVER) "Object__|", IA.HELD "Times Held__(add-commas)(r)", COUNT(A.ID) "Total Accesses__(add-commas)(r)", CAST ((CAST (IA.HELD AS FLOAT) / CAST (COUNT(A.ID) AS FLOAT) * 100) AS DECIMAL) "%__(suffix '%')(r)" FROM (SELECT A.RECEIVER, COUNT(DISTINCT A.ID) "HELD" FROM (SELECT ALH.ACCESS FROM LOCK L, INDIRECTACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH WHERE L.LOCK = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = L.ID UNION SELECT ALH.ACCESS FROM LOCKSHELD LH, INDIRECTACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH WHERE LH.LOCKHELD = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = LH.LOCKEVENT) AS AIDS, INDIRECTACCESS A WHERE A.ID = AIDS.ACCESS GROUP BY A.RECEIVER) AS IA, INDIRECTACCESS A, OBJECT O, OBJECT DT WHERE A.RECEIVER = IA.RECEIVER AND O.ID = A.RECEIVER AND DT.ID = O.TYPE GROUP BY DT.PACKAGENAME,DT.CLASSNAME,DT.CLASSCODE,A.RECEIVER,IA.HELD ORDER BY 1,2,3

query.description: What objects have the potential for false sharing?

ad-hoc.query:
-- META-BEGIN(no-rows) -- No objects in the program were observed that could exhibit false sharing -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(empty-is-good-news) -- No objects in the program were observed that could exhibit false sharing -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(result-is-bad-news) -- Objects in the program were observed that could exhibit false sharing -- META-END -- META-BEGIN(doc) --

-- What objects have the potential for false sharing? --

 --

-- Lists all objects in the program that may exhibit false sharing, which occurs -- when different fields in the same object are accessed mostly in distinct -- threads. A high interleaving % indicates how often accesses of other fields -- in the same object occurred in between accesses of this field in the given -- thread. A higher percentage indicates a higher risk of false sharing -- negatively impacting performances in this program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Object → Field →Thread
ColumnsReadsThe number of times this field was read in this thread
WritesThe number of times this field was written in this thread
Interleaving %The frequency with which accesses of other fields occurred in between accesses of this field during this period of time
StartThe time of the first field access in this block.
StopThe time of the last field access in this block.
--

-- META-END SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", OBJID(B.RECEIVER) "Object", F.FIELDNAME "Field", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", OBJID(B.INTHREAD) "Thread__('thread.gif')|", B.READS "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", B.WRITES "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", B.QUOTIENT "Interleaving %__(suffix '%')(r)", B.START "Start", B.STOP "Stop", B.RECEIVER "Receiver__(hide)" FROM BLOCKSTATS B, FIELD F, OBJECT CO WHERE F.ID = B.FIELD AND CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND B.QUOTIENT > 0.10 ORDER BY CO.PACKAGENAME, CO.CLASSNAME, B.RECEIVER, F.FIELDNAME

query.description: What objects were used as both a dynamic and an intrinsic lock?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No locks are held as both an intrinsic and a util.concurrent lock. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- Are any locks used as both an intrinsic and a util.concurrent lock? --

--

-- Lists all of the locks in the program that are acquired both as an intrinsic and -- a util.concurrent lock. While it is possible that this is the intent of the -- programmer, it is very likely that this is the result of a mixed locking policy. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsLockA lock identifier
--

--END-INFO SELECT OBJID(Lock) "Lock__('lock.gif')", LI.LOCK "Lock__(hide)" FROM LOCK LI WHERE STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' GROUP BY LI.LOCK HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT LI.TYPE) > 1

query.description: What static fields are accessed in this thread?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No static fields are accessed in this thread. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (static) are accessed in this thread?? --

--

--Lists all fields that were accessed at some point in the given thread. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsRead CountThe number of times this field was read in this thread
Write CountThe number of times this field was written in this thread
--

--END-INFO select O.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", O.ClassName "Class", O.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field__|", F.Code "Field__(icon)", FS.ReadCount "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", FS.WriteCount "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", OBJID(?Thread?) "In Thread__('thread.gif')", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)" from OBJECT O, FIELD F, FIELDSTATICTHREAD FS, OBJECT THO where F.DeclaringType = O.Id and FS.FIELD = F.ID and THO.ID = FS.Thread AND FS.Thread = ?Thread? order by O.PackageName,O.ClassName,F.FieldName,THO.ThreadName

query.description: What static fields are protected by this lock, and how often?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No accesses occur while this lock is held --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What fields (non-static) are protected by this lock, and how often? --

--

-- Lists all of the fields that were accessed while this lock was held -- and how often each was accessed with or without the lock being held. -- Clicking on a field will open its declaration in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field
ColumnsTimes HeldThe number of times the lock was held while this field -- was accessed
Total AccessesThe total number of accesses made to this field
%The proportion of times the lock was held to the total -- number of field accesses, expressed as a percentage
--

--

Example

-- --

--The above example shows two fields in EditBus, --components and copyComponents, that are --sometimes accessed while this lock is held. One of the fields, --copyComponents, is always accessed while the given lock is --held and therefore has the field as part of its lock set. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT DT.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", DT.CLASSNAME "Class", DT.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", F.FIELDNAME "Field__|", F.CODE "Field__(icon)", F.ID "FieldId__(hide)", CAST ((CAST (FA.HELD AS FLOAT) / CAST (COUNT(A.ID) AS FLOAT) * 100) AS DECIMAL) "% Held__(suffix '%')(r)", OBJID(?Lock?) "Lock__('lock.gif')", FA.HELD "Accesses With Lock Held__(add-commas)(r)", COUNT(A.ID) "Total Accesses__(add-commas)(r)" FROM (SELECT A.FIELD, COUNT(DISTINCT A.ID) "HELD" FROM (SELECT ALH.ACCESS FROM LOCK L, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH WHERE L.LOCK = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = L.ID UNION SELECT ALH.ACCESS FROM LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH WHERE LH.LOCKHELD = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = LH.LOCKEVENT) AS AIDS, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = AIDS.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD GROUP BY A.FIELD) AS FA, FIELD F, ACCESS A, OBJECT DT WHERE F.ID = FA.FIELD AND A.FIELD = F.ID AND DT.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND F.STATIC = 'Y' GROUP BY DT.PACKAGENAME,DT.CLASSNAME,DT.CLASSCODE,F.FIELDNAME,F.CODE,F.ID,FA.HELD ORDER BY 1,2,4

query.description: What threads access shared state in this program?

ad-hoc.query:
--NO-ROWS-MSG=No threads were observed in this run of the program. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What threads are in this program? --

 --

-- Lists all of the threads in the program. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsThreadThe name of the thread.
Thread StartThe thread's start time.
Thread StopThe thread's stop time.
--

--END-INFO SELECT OBJID(A.INTHREAD) "Thread__('thread.gif')(c)", CASE WHEN L.LFIRST IS NULL OR A.AFIRST < L.LFIRST THEN A.AFIRST ELSE L.LFIRST END "Started__(r)", CASE WHEN L.LLAST IS NOT NULL AND A.ALAST < L.LLAST THEN L.LLAST ELSE A.ALAST END "Finished__(r)", {fn TIMESTAMPDIFF(SQL_TSI_FRAC_SECOND, CASE WHEN L.LFIRST IS NULL OR A.AFIRST < L.LFIRST THEN A.AFIRST ELSE L.LFIRST END, CASE WHEN L.LLAST IS NOT NULL AND A.ALAST < L.LLAST THEN L.LLAST ELSE A.ALAST END )} "Lifetime__(human-readable-duration)(r)", L.BLOCK "Total Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", CASE WHEN L.BLOCK IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE CAST (CAST (L.BLOCK AS FLOAT) / CAST ({fn TIMESTAMPDIFF(SQL_TSI_FRAC_SECOND, CASE WHEN L.LFIRST IS NULL OR A.AFIRST < L.LFIRST THEN A.AFIRST ELSE L.LFIRST END, CASE WHEN L.LLAST IS NOT NULL AND A.ALAST < L.LLAST THEN L.LLAST ELSE A.ALAST END )} AS FLOAT) * 100 AS DECIMAL(6,3) ) END "% Blocked__(r)(suffix-only-if-nonempty '%')", A.INTHREAD "Thread__(hide)" FROM (SELECT INTHREAD, MIN(TS) "AFIRST", MAX(TS) "ALAST" FROM ACCESS GROUP BY INTHREAD) AS A LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT INTHREAD, MIN(START) "LFIRST", MAX(STOP) "LLAST", sum(Duration) "BLOCK", sum(duration) / count (startevent) as "BLOCK_AVE" FROM LOCKDURATION WHERE STATE = 'BLOCKING' GROUP BY INTHREAD) AS L ON A.INTHREAD = L.INTHREAD ORDER BY 1

query.description: What threads are blocked for the longest time?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No locks were observed to be acquired during this run of the program. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- What threads are blocked for the longest time? --

--

-- Lists all of the threads in the program, in descending order of the -- average amount of time a lock blocks this thread each time it is -- acquired. Threads with a high average block time can indicate -- high contention in part of your program, and may be a source of -- slowdown. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsLockA lock identifier
Times AcquiredThe number of times this lock was acquired
Total Block TimeThe total amount of time that threads spent waiting for -- this lock
Average Block TimeThe average amount of time a thread waits before the -- lock was acquired
--

SELECT OBJID(A.INTHREAD) "Thread__('thread.gif')(c)", CASE WHEN L.BLOCK IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE L.BLOCK END "Total Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", CASE WHEN L.BLOCK_AVE IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE L.BLOCK_AVE END "Average Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", {fn TIMESTAMPDIFF(SQL_TSI_FRAC_SECOND, CASE WHEN L.LFIRST IS NULL OR A.AFIRST < L.LFIRST THEN A.AFIRST ELSE L.LFIRST END, CASE WHEN L.LLAST IS NOT NULL AND A.ALAST < L.LLAST THEN L.LLAST ELSE A.ALAST END )} "Thread Duration__(human-readable-duration)(r)", CASE WHEN L.BLOCK IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE CAST (CAST (L.BLOCK AS FLOAT) / CAST ({fn TIMESTAMPDIFF(SQL_TSI_FRAC_SECOND, CASE WHEN L.LFIRST IS NULL OR A.AFIRST < L.LFIRST THEN A.AFIRST ELSE L.LFIRST END, CASE WHEN L.LLAST IS NOT NULL AND A.ALAST < L.LLAST THEN L.LLAST ELSE A.ALAST END )} AS FLOAT) * 100 AS DECIMAL(6,3) ) END "% Blocked__(r)(suffix-only-if-nonempty '%')", CASE WHEN L.LFIRST IS NULL OR A.AFIRST < L.LFIRST THEN A.AFIRST ELSE L.LFIRST END "Thread Start", CASE WHEN L.LLAST IS NOT NULL AND A.ALAST < L.LLAST THEN L.LLAST ELSE A.ALAST END "Thread Stop", A.INTHREAD "Thread__(hide)" FROM (SELECT INTHREAD, MIN(TS) "AFIRST", MAX(TS) "ALAST" FROM ACCESS GROUP BY INTHREAD) AS A LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT INTHREAD, MIN(START) "LFIRST", MAX(STOP) "LLAST", sum(Duration) "BLOCK", sum(duration) / count (startevent) as "BLOCK_AVE" FROM LOCKDURATION WHERE STATE = 'BLOCKING' GROUP BY INTHREAD) AS L ON A.INTHREAD = L.INTHREAD ORDER BY L.BLOCK DESC NULLS LAST

query.description: What threads read and write this field?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What threads read and write this field? --

--

-- Shows the number of reads and writes each thread that accesses this -- field makes. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsReadsThe read count of this field
WritesThe write count of this field
Reads During ConstructionThe read count of this field made while the owning -- object was under construction
Writes During ConstructionThe write count of this field made while the owning -- object was under construction
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example shows a breakdown of the threads that read and write --to this particular instance of f_location in the --Ship class. During this Flashlight Run, --f_location was written to by both Thread-2 and --Thread-4. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT '?Instance?' "Instance", '?Instance (Image)?' "Instance__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field", F.Code "Field__(icon)", THO.ThreadName "Thread__('thread.gif')|", FI.ReadCount + FI.ReadUCCount "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", FI.WriteCount + FI.WriteUCCount "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", FI.ReadUCCount "Reads During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", FI.WriteUCCount "Writes During Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", A.AMIN "First Access", A.AMAX "Last Access", THO.ID "Thread__(hide)" FROM FIELDINSTANCETHREAD FI, OBJECT THO, FIELD F, OBJECT CO, (SELECT FIELD,RECEIVER,MIN(TS) "AMIN",MAX(TS) "AMAX" FROM ACCESS GROUP BY FIELD,RECEIVER) A WHERE FI.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND FI.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND THO.ID = FI.THREAD AND F.ID = FI.FIELD AND CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND A.FIELD = FI.FIELD AND A.RECEIVER = FI.RECEIVER

query.description: What threads read and write this static field?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What threads read and write this field? --

--

-- Shows the number of reads and writes each thread that accesses this -- field makes. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsReadsThe read count of this field
WritesThe write count of this field
Reads During ConstructionThe read count of this field made while the owning -- object was under construction
Writes During ConstructionThe write count of this field made while the owning -- object was under construction
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example shows a breakdown of the threads that read and write --the static field checkedForManager in the --BshClassManager class. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT CO.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", CO.ClassName "Class", CO.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", F.FieldName "Field", F.Code "Field__(icon)", THO.ThreadName "Thread__('thread.gif')|", FI.ReadCount "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", FI.WriteCount "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(sum on 2,3)(r)", A.AMIN "First Access", A.AMAX "Last Access", THO.ID "Thread__(hide)" FROM FIELDSTATICTHREAD FI, OBJECT THO, FIELD F, OBJECT CO, (SELECT FIELD,MIN(TS) "AMIN",MAX(TS) "AMAX" FROM ACCESS GROUP BY FIELD) A WHERE FI.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND THO.ID = FI.THREAD AND F.ID = FI.FIELD AND CO.ID = F.DECLARINGTYPE AND A.FIELD = FI.FIELD

query.description: When and by what threads was this field accessed?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- When and by what threads was this field accessed? --

--

-- Shows a summary of field accesses in the program. Chronologically consecutive -- accesses made in the same thread are condensed into one entry. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsHappens-Before'Y' when Flashlight has detected a happens-before relationship from the last access of the previous row to the first access of this row.
ReadsThe number of reads made in this set of accesses.
WritesThe number of writes made in this set of accesses.
Reads Under ConstructionThe number of reads made while the field's object was under construction
Writes Under ConstructionThe number of writes made while the field's object was under construction
StartThe time of the earliest access in this entry
WritesThe time of the latest access in this entry
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example lists all of the accesses to the static field --INSTANCE in the GameMap class observed during --this Flashlight run, from earliest to latest. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT '?Instance?' "Instance", '?Instance (Image)?' "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", S.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')|", S.HAPPENSBEFORE "Happens-Before", CASE WHEN S.HAPPENSBEFORE = 'Yes' THEN 'happens_before.gif' WHEN S.HAPPENSBEFORE = 'No' THEN 'happens_before_no.gif' ELSE 'empty.gif' END "Happens-Before__(icon)", S.READS "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.WRITES "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.READSUC "Reads Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.WRITESUC "Writes Under Construction__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.STARTTIME "First Access", S.ENDTIME "Last Access", S.THREADID "ThreadId__(hide)", S.LASTWRITETIME "LastWriteTime__(hide)", S.LASTWRITETHREAD "LastWriteThread__(hide)" FROM TABLE (ACCESSSUMMARY(?FieldId?, ?Receiver?)) S

query.description: When and by what threads was this object indirectly accessed?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- When and by what threads was this object indirectly accessed? --

--

-- Shows each call to this object and what thread it happened in, -- ordered by the time it occurred. Clicking on an access will open -- the relevant line in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTable
ColumnsThreadThe thread this object was indirectly accessed in
TimeThe time this object was indirectly accessed
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example lists all of the indirect accesses recorded for a --particular object in this Flashlight run, from earliest to latest. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT THO.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')|", IA.TS "Time", CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__(hide)", CO.CLASSNAME "Class__(hide)", S.ATLINE "Line__(hide)", IA.TRACE "ATRACE__(hide)" FROM INDIRECTACCESS IA, TRACE T, SITE S, OBJECT CO, OBJECT THO WHERE IA.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND T.ID = IA.TRACE AND S.ID = T.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS AND THO.ID = IA.INTHREAD

query.description: When and by what threads was this static field accessed?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- When and by what threads was this field accessed? --

--

-- Shows a summary of field accesses in the program. Chronologically consecutive -- accesses made in the same thread are condensed into one entry. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Field → Thread
ColumnsReadsThe number of consecutive reads made by this thread
WritesThe number of consecutive writes made by this thread
StartThe time of the earliest access in this entry
WritesThe time of the latest access in this entry
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example lists all of the accesses to the static field --INSTANCE in the GameMap class observed during --this Flashlight run, from earliest to latest. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT '?Package?' "Package__('@PK')", '?Class?' "Class", '?Class (Image)?' "Class__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", S.THREADNAME "Thread__('thread.gif')|", S.HAPPENSBEFORE "Happens-Before", CASE WHEN S.HAPPENSBEFORE = 'Yes' THEN 'happens_before.gif' WHEN S.HAPPENSBEFORE = 'No' THEN 'happens_before_no.gif' ELSE 'empty.gif' END "Happens-Before__(icon)", S.READS "Reads__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.WRITES "Writes__(blank-if '0')(add-commas)(r)", S.STARTTIME "First Access", S.ENDTIME "Last Access", S.THREADID "ThreadId__(hide)", S.LASTWRITETIME "LastWriteTime__(hide)", S.LASTWRITETHREAD "LastWriteThread__(hide)" FROM TABLE (STATICACCESSSUMMARY(?FieldId?)) S

query.description: Where and in what threads does this lock edge occur?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- What are the lock events for this lock graph edge? --

--

-- Lists all of the lock events that contribute to a particular edge of -- the lock cycle, and where they occur in the program. Clicking on a -- lock event will open the line that acquired it in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line → Thread
ColumnsLockEventA lock event identifier
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example shows lock events contributing to a particular lock --graph edge on lines 301 and 465 of GameMap. Expanding one --of the lines shows a list of all of the lock acquisition events that --occurred on that line. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT LO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", LO.CLASSNAME "Class", MAX(LO.CLASSCODE) "Class__(icon)", S.LOCATION "Location", MAX(S.LOCATIONCODE) "Location__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line", COALESCELOCKTRACETHREADS(L.LOCKTRACE) "Trace (Occurrences By Thread)__('thread.gif')|", OBJID(L.LOCK) "Lock__('lock.gif')", LKCO.CLASSNAME "Lock Class", MAX(LKCO.CLASSCODE) "Lock Class__(icon)", CASE WHEN L.TYPE = 'U' THEN 'java.util.concurrent' ELSE 'Intrinsic' END "Lock Type", CASE WHEN L.LOCKISTHIS = 'Y' THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'N' END "Lock on this__(blank-if 'N')", CASE WHEN L.LOCKISCLASS = 'Y' THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'N' END "Lock on class__(blank-if 'N')", MIN(L.TS) "First Occurrence", MAX(L.TS) "Last Occurence", MAX(LAH.LOCKSHELD) "Locks Already Held__(r)", MAX(TR.ID) "LATRACE__(hide)", L.LOCK "Lock__(hide)", L.LOCKTRACE "LOCKTRACE__(hide)" FROM LOCKSHELD LH, LOCK L, TRACE TR, SITE S, OBJECT LO, OBJECT THO, OBJECT LK, OBJECT LKCO, (SELECT LOCKEVENT,COUNT(*) "LOCKSHELD" FROM LOCKSHELD GROUP BY LOCKEVENT) LAH WHERE LH.LOCKHELD = ?LockHeld? AND LH.LOCKACQUIRED = ?LockAcquired? AND L.ID = LH.LOCKEVENT AND TR.ID = L.TRACE AND S.ID = TR.SITE AND LO.ID = S.INCLASS AND THO.ID = L.INTHREAD AND LK.ID = L.LOCK AND LKCO.ID = LK.TYPE AND LAH.LOCKEVENT = L.ID GROUP BY L.LOCKTRACE, LO.PACKAGENAME, LO.CLASSNAME, S.LOCATION, S.ATLINE, L.LOCK, LKCO.CLASSNAME, L.TYPE, L.LOCKISTHIS, L.LOCKISCLASS ORDER BY LO.PACKAGENAME, LO.CLASSNAME, S.LOCATION, S.ATLINE, COALESCELOCKTRACETHREADS(L.LOCKTRACE)

query.description: Where and in what threads is a lock acquired here?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT '?Package?' "Package__('@PK')", '?Class?' "Class", '?Class (Image)?' "Class__(icon)", '?Method?' "Method", '?Method (Image)?' "Method__(icon)", ?Line? "Line__(r)", COALESCELOCKTRACETHREADS(L.LOCKTRACE) "Threads__('thread.gif')|", OBJID(L.LOCK) "Lock__('lock.gif')", LKCO.CLASSNAME "Lock Class", MAX(LKCO.CLASSCODE) "Lock Class__(icon)", CASE WHEN L.TYPE = 'U' THEN 'java.util.concurrent' ELSE 'Intrinsic' END "Lock Type", CASE WHEN L.LOCKISTHIS = 'Y' THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'N' END "Lock on this__(blank-if 'N')", CASE WHEN L.LOCKISCLASS = 'Y' THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'N' END "Lock on class__(blank-if 'N')", MIN(L.TS) "First Occurrence", MAX(L.TS) "Last Occurrence", MAX(LH.LOCKSHELD) "Locks Already Held__(r)", TR.ID "LATRACE__(hide)", L.LOCKTRACE "LOCKTRACE__(hide)" FROM OBJECT O, SITE S, TRACE TR, LOCK L, (SELECT LOCKEVENT,COUNT(*) "LOCKSHELD" FROM LOCKSHELD GROUP BY LOCKEVENT) LH, OBJECT LK, OBJECT LKCO WHERE O.CLASSNAME = '?Class?' AND O.PACKAGENAME = '?Package?' AND S.INCLASS = O.ID AND S.ATLINE = ?Line? AND TR.SITE = S.ID AND L.TRACE = TR.ID AND LH.LOCKEVENT = L.ID AND LK.ID = L.LOCK AND LKCO.ID = LK.TYPE GROUP BY L.LOCKTRACE,TR.ID,L.LOCK,LKCO.CLASSNAME,L.TYPE,L.LOCKISTHIS,L.LOCKISCLASS ORDER BY OBJID(L.LOCK),MIN(L.TS)

query.description: Where are fields accessed while this lock is held?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No accesses occur while this lock is held --BEGIN-INFO --

-- Where are fields accessed while this lock is held? --

--

-- Lists all of the places in the program where a field is accessed -- while this lock is held. Clicking on a line will open it in the -- code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--In the above example, fields were accessed on four different lines of --code in the GameMap class while this lock was held. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT DISTINCT PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CLASSNAME "Class", CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", ATLINE "Line__(r)|" FROM (SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME, CO.CLASSNAME, CO.CLASSCODE, S.ATLINE FROM LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, TRACE T, SITE S, OBJECT CO WHERE LH.LOCKHELD = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = LH.LOCKEVENT AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND T.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = T.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS UNION SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME, CO.CLASSNAME, CO.CLASSCODE, S.ATLINE FROM LOCK L, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, TRACE T, SITE S, OBJECT CO WHERE L.LOCK = ?Lock? AND ALH.LASTACQUISITION = L.ID AND A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND T.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = T.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS) AS ACCESSES ORDER BY 1,2,4

query.description: Where does a thread hold a lock and acquire another?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No locks were observed to be acquired while another was already held during this run of the program. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- Where does a thread hold a lock and acquire another? --

--

-- Provides an overview of all the locking interaction in the program. -- Lists every line of code where a lock is acquired while already -- holding at least one lock. Next to each line is listed the most -- locks the program ever holds at this point. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line
ColumnsMost Locks Already HeldThe maximum number of locks already held when we -- acquire the lock at this point
--

-- --

Example

-- -- -- --

--The above example lists three different lines of code in three different --class files - line 121 of CommandVisitor, line 210 of --Server, and line 116 of TurnCyclicBarrier. On --each line a lock was acquired while some other lock was already held. --The maximum number of locks held before a lock was acquired on that --particular line was one, two, and two respectively. --

--END-INFO SELECT PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CLASSNAME "Class", CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", LOCATION "Method", LOCATIONCODE "Method__(icon)", ATLINE "Line__|(r)", MAX (HELDCOUNT) "Most Locks Already Held__(r)(max on 2)" FROM ( SELECT COUNT (LH.LOCKHELD) "HELDCOUNT", LO.CLASSNAME, LO.CLASSCODE, LO.PACKAGENAME, S.LOCATION, S.LOCATIONCODE, S.ATLINE FROM LOCKSHELD LH, LOCK LE, TRACE TR, SITE S, OBJECT LO WHERE LH.LOCKEVENT = LE.ID AND TR.ID = LE.TRACE AND S.ID = TR.SITE AND LO.ID = S.INCLASS GROUP BY LH.LOCKEVENT,LO.CLASSNAME,LO.CLASSCODE,LO.PACKAGENAME,S.LOCATION,S.LOCATIONCODE,S.ATLINE,LE.TRACE) AS T GROUP BY CLASSNAME,CLASSCODE,LOCATION,LOCATIONCODE,PACKAGENAME,ATLINE ORDER BY PACKAGENAME,CLASSNAME,LOCATION,ATLINE

query.description: Where is a lock held and state in two or more classes accessed?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT OBJID(LOCK) "Lock", MAX(AGG.TYPES) "Classes Accessed" FROM ( SELECT E.EVENT, COUNT(DISTINCT E.DECLARINGTYPE) "TYPES" FROM ( SELECT ALH.LASTACQUISITION "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD UNION SELECT LH.LOCKHELDEVENT "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND LH.LOCKEVENT=ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND F.ID = A.FIELD ) E GROUP BY E.EVENT ) AGG, LOCK L WHERE L.ID = AGG.EVENT GROUP BY L.LOCK HAVING MAX(AGG.TYPES) > 1 ORDER BY MAX(AGG.TYPES) DESC

query.description: Where is a lock held and state in two or more packages accessed?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT OBJID(LOCK), MAX(AGG.PACKAGES) "Packages Accessed" FROM ( SELECT E.EVENT, COUNT(DISTINCT CO.PACKAGENAME) "PACKAGES" FROM ( SELECT ALH.LASTACQUISITION "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND F.ID = A.FIELD UNION SELECT LH.LOCKHELDEVENT "EVENT", F.DECLARINGTYPE FROM ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCKSHELD LH, ACCESS A, FIELD F WHERE A.ID = ALH.ACCESS AND LH.LOCKEVENT=ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND F.ID = A.FIELD ) E, OBJECT CO WHERE CO.ID = E.DECLARINGTYPE GROUP BY E.EVENT ) AGG, LOCK L WHERE L.ID = AGG.EVENT GROUP BY L.LOCK HAVING MAX(AGG.PACKAGES) > 1 ORDER BY MAX(AGG.PACKAGES) DESC

query.description: Where is this field accessed by the program?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- Where is this field accessed by the program? --

--

-- Lists all of the places in the program that access this field at -- some point in time. Clicking on a line will open up the field -- access in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--In the above example, the field is accessed on lines 44 and 53 of --GameMap. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__ ('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__|", '?Instance?' "Instance", '?Instance (Image)?' "Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", COUNT (A.TS) "Accesses Via This Stack Trace__(add-commas)(r)", MIN (A.TS) "First Access", MAX (A.TS) "Last Access", TR.ID "ATRACE__(hide)" FROM ACCESS A, TRACE TR, SITE S, OBJECT CO WHERE A.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND A.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND TR.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = TR.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS GROUP BY CO.PACKAGENAME, CO.CLASSNAME, CO.CLASSCODE, S.ATLINE, TR.ID ORDER BY CO.PACKAGENAME, CO.CLASSNAME, S.ATLINE, MIN(A.TS)

"Instance__(icon)", '?Field?' "Field", '?Field (Image)?' "Field__(icon)", COUNT (A.TS) "Accesses Via This Stack Trace__(add-commas)(r)", OBJID(?Thread?) "In Thread__('thread.gif')", MIN (A.TS) "First Access", MAX (A.TS) "Last Access", TR.ID "ATRACE__(hide)" FROM ACCESS A, TRACE TR, SITE S, OBJECT CO WHERE A.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND A.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND TR.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = TR.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS AND A.INTHREAD = ?Thread? query.description: Where is this field accessed while this lock is held?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- Where is this field accessed while this lock is held? --

--

-- Lists all of the places in the program that access this field while -- the given lock is being held. Clicking on a line will open up the -- field access in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example shows four lines of code in the Ship --class where this field is accessed while the given lock is held. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__(r)|" FROM ACCESS A, TRACE TR, SITE S, OBJECT CO, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCK L WHERE A.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND A.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND TR.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = TR.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS AND ALH.ACCESS = A.ID AND L.ID = ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND L.LOCK = ?Lock? UNION DISTINCT SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__(r)|" FROM ACCESS A, TRACE TR, SITE S, OBJECT CO, ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH, LOCKSHELD L WHERE A.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND A.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND TR.ID = A.TRACE AND S.ID = TR.SITE AND CO.ID = S.INCLASS AND ALH.ACCESS = A.ID AND L.LOCKEVENT = ALH.LASTACQUISITION AND L.LOCKHELD = ?Lock? ORDER BY 1,2,3

query.description: Where is this field accessed while this lock is not held?

ad-hoc.query:
--BEGIN-INFO --

-- Where is this field accessed while this lock is not held? --

--

-- Lists all of the places in the program that access this field while -- a given lock is not held. Clicking on a line will open up the field -- access in the code view. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--The above example shows three lines of code in the Ship --class where this field is accessed while the given lock is not held. --

-- --END-INFO SELECT DISTINCT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", CO.CLASSCODE "Class__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__(r)|" FROM ACCESS A INNER JOIN TRACE TR ON TR.ID = A.TRACE INNER JOIN SITE S ON S.ID = TR.SITE INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = S.INCLASS LEFT OUTER JOIN ACCESSLOCKSHELD ALH ON ALH.ACCESS = A.ID LEFT OUTER JOIN LOCK L ON L.ID = ALH.LASTACQUISITION WHERE A.FIELD = ?FieldId? AND A.RECEIVER = ?Receiver? AND (L.LOCK IS NULL OR (L.LOCK != ?Lock? AND (NOT EXISTS (SELECT LOCKHELD FROM LOCKSHELD WHERE LOCKEVENT = ALH.LASTACQUISITION) OR (NOT ?Lock? IN (SELECT LOCKHELD FROM LOCKSHELD WHERE LOCKEVENT = ALH.LASTACQUISITION)))))

query.description: Where is this lock acquired in this thread?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", MAX(CO.CLASSCODE) "Class__(icon)", S.LOCATION "Method", MAX(S.LOCATIONCODE) "Method__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__]", COALESCELOCKTRACETHREADS(LE.LOCKTRACE) "Trace (Occurrences By Thread)__('thread.gif')|", OBJID(LE.LOCK) "Lock__('lock.gif')", MAX(LKCO.CLASSNAME) "Lock Class", MAX(LKCO.CLASSCODE) "Lock Class__(icon)", CASE WHEN MAX(LE.LOCKISTHIS) = 'Y' THEN 'Lock on This' WHEN MAX(LE.LOCKISCLASS) = 'Y' THEN 'Lock on Class' WHEN MAX(LE.TYPE) = 'I' THEN 'Intrinsic Lock' ELSE 'java.util.concurrent Lock' END "Type", CASE WHEN MAX(LE.LOCKISTHIS) = 'Y' THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'N' END "Lock on this__(blank-if 'N')", CASE WHEN MAX(LE.LOCKISCLASS) = 'Y' THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'N' END "Lock on class__(blank-if 'N')", MIN(LE.TS) "First Occurrence", MAX(LE.TS) "Last Occurrence", COALESCE(MAX(LH.LOCKSHELD),0) "Locks Already Held__(r)", LE.LOCKTRACE "LOCKTRACE__(hide)", MAX(LE.TRACE) "LATRACE__(hide)" FROM LOCK LE INNER JOIN TRACE TR ON TR.ID = LE.TRACE INNER JOIN SITE S ON S.ID = TR.SITE INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = S.INCLASS INNER JOIN OBJECT LK ON LK.ID = LE.LOCK INNER JOIN OBJECT LKCO ON LKCO.ID = LK.TYPE LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT LOCKEVENT,COUNT(*) "LOCKSHELD" FROM LOCKSHELD GROUP BY LOCKEVENT) LH ON LH.LOCKEVENT = LE.ID WHERE LE.LOCK = ?Lock? AND LE.INTHREAD = ?Thread? AND LE.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' GROUP BY LE.LOCKTRACE,CO.PACKAGENAME,CO.CLASSNAME,S.LOCATION,S.ATLINE,LE.LOCK ORDER BY CO.PACKAGENAME,CO.CLASSNAME,S.LOCATION,S.ATLINE,COALESCELOCKTRACETHREADS(LE.LOCKTRACE)

query.description: Where is this lock acquired?

ad-hoc.query: SELECT CO.PACKAGENAME "Package__('@PK')", CO.CLASSNAME "Class", MAX(CO.CLASSCODE) "Class__(icon)", S.LOCATION "Method", MAX(S.LOCATIONCODE) "Method__(icon)", S.ATLINE "Line__]", COALESCELOCKTRACETHREADS(LE.LOCKTRACE) "Trace (Occurrences By Thread)__('thread.gif')|", OBJID(LE.LOCK) "Lock__('lock.gif')", MAX(LKCO.CLASSNAME) "Lock Class", MAX(LKCO.CLASSCODE) "Lock Class__(icon)", CASE WHEN MAX(LE.LOCKISTHIS) = 'Y' THEN 'Lock on This' WHEN MAX(LE.LOCKISCLASS) = 'Y' THEN 'Lock on Class' WHEN MAX(LE.TYPE) = 'I' THEN 'Intrinsic Lock' ELSE 'java.util.concurrent Lock' END "Type", MIN(LE.TS) "First Occurrence", MAX(LE.TS) "Last Occurrence", COALESCE(MAX(LH.LOCKSHELD),0) "Locks Already Held__(r)", LE.LOCKTRACE "LOCKTRACE__(hide)", MAX(LE.TRACE) "LATRACE__(hide)" FROM LOCK LE INNER JOIN TRACE TR ON TR.ID = LE.TRACE INNER JOIN SITE S ON S.ID = TR.SITE INNER JOIN OBJECT CO ON CO.ID = S.INCLASS INNER JOIN OBJECT LK ON LK.ID = LE.LOCK INNER JOIN OBJECT LKCO ON LKCO.ID = LK.TYPE LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT LOCKEVENT,COUNT(*) "LOCKSHELD" FROM LOCKSHELD GROUP BY LOCKEVENT) LH ON LH.LOCKEVENT = LE.ID WHERE LE.LOCK = ?Lock? AND LE.STATE = 'AFTER ACQUISITION' GROUP BY LE.LOCKTRACE,CO.PACKAGENAME,CO.CLASSNAME,S.LOCATION,S.ATLINE,LE.LOCK ORDER BY CO.PACKAGENAME,CO.CLASSNAME,S.LOCATION,S.ATLINE,COALESCELOCKTRACETHREADS(LE.LOCKTRACE)

query.description: Which threads and what code contend for this lock?

ad-hoc.query:
-- NO-ROWS-MSG=No threads were forced to wait for this lock. -- This query shows the locations and threads of all places this lock -- was contended for. Some entries appear to be duplicates, but actually -- represent different stack traces. --BEGIN-INFO --

-- Which threads and what code contend for this lock? --

--

-- Shows all of the locations and threads that contend for this lock, -- organized first by code location and then by thread. Some entries -- in this query may appear to be duplicates, but actually have -- different stack traces. For each entry, the amount of time that the -- thread blocks and the number of times the lock is acquired is -- listed. -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- --
Displayed asTree-Table
Tree StructurePackage → Class → Line → Thread
ColumnsBlockTimeThe amount of time the thread spends blocking while -- acquiring this lock
Times AcquiredThe number of times the lock is acquired in this thread
Total Block TimeThe total amount of time spent blocking while the -- resource waits to acquire this lock
Average Block TimeThe average amount of time this thread spends waiting -- for this lock
--

-- --

Example

-- --

--In the above example, Thread-5 is the only thread observed --to contend for this lock at line 82 of Reporter. The lock --was acquired five times at this line of code, and the thread blocked an --average of 3,916 nanoseconds each time. --

--END-INFO select lo.PackageName "Package__('@PK')", lo.ClassName "Class", lo.ClassCode "Class__(icon)", s.AtLine "Line__]", tho.ThreadName "Thread__|", sum(ld.Duration) "BlockTime__(human-readable-duration)(r)", count(ld.lock) "Times Acquired__(sum)(add-commas)(r)", sum(ld.Duration) "Total Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", sum(ld.Duration) / count (ld.lock) "Average Block Time__(human-readable-duration)(r)", le.trace "LATRACE__(hide)" from LOCKDURATION ld, LOCK le, TRACE tr, SITE s, OBJECT lo, OBJECT tho where ld.Lock=?Lock? and ld.State = 'BLOCKING' and le.Id=ld.StartEvent and tr.Id = le.Trace and s.Id = tr.Site and lo.Id = s.InClass and tho.Id = ld.InThread group by lo.PackageName,lo.ClassName, lo.ClassCode, s.AtLine, tho.ThreadName, le.trace order by lo.PackageName, lo.ClassName, s.AtLine, tho.ThreadName, sum(ld.Duration) desc

category.no-data: No API specific concurrency information was observed in the program.

category.has-data: Queries that show lock use that may cause the program to deadlock.
category.no-data: No locking that could potentially cause deadlock was observed in the program.

category.has-data: Queries about lock use in the program.
category.no-data: No lock use was observed in the program.

category.has-data: Queries that show happens-before relationships between threads defined by the Java memory model.
category.no-data: No happens-before relationships between threads were observed in the program.

category.has-data: Queries that highlight potential performance bottlenecks in the program.
category.no-data: No potential performance bottlenecks were observed in the program.

category.has-data: Queries that show state (fields, not local variables or parameters) shared between multiple threads.
category.no-data: No state (fields, not local variables or parameters) was shared between multiple threads.

category.has-data: Queries about threads in the program.
category.no-data: No threads were observed in the program.
